0.title: Relating to the Dealer Recovery Program
0.description: Relating to the Dealer Recovery Program

1.title: Requiring authorization from the Legislature before submitting an application for an MS-4 permit to the United States Environmental Protection Agency
1.description: The purpose of this bill is to require a county to obtain express authorization from the Legislature in the form of a concurrent resolution before submitting an application for an MS-4 permit to the United States Environmental Protection Agency and providing that a county may not be required to comply with terms of an MS-4 permit unless the state or federal government pays for the cost of compliance.

2.title: Prohibiting state agencies and departments from acting outside their statutory scopes of authority
2.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit state agencies and departments from acting outside their statutory scopes of authority.

3.title: Reducing state income taxes for state and federal retirees by increasing the exemption on retirement income
3.description: Reducing state income taxes for state and federal retirees by increasing the exemption on retirement income

4.title: Relating to replacing the present crime of burglary with the crime of home invasion
4.description: The purpose of this bill is to replace the present crime of burglary with the crime of home invasion. This bill provides for the criminal offenses of home invasion in the first, second, third and fourth degrees.Â The bill prescribes penalties.

5.title: Allowing parents or the school to serve sweets during the holidays if the school receives parental or guardian consent
5.description: Allowing parents or the school to serve sweets during the holidays if the school receives parental or guardian consent

6.title: Establishing seniority rights for public employees
6.description: Establishing seniority rights for public employees

7.title: Providing state health care services for all active and inactive duty military personnel
7.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide state health care services for all active and inactive duty military personnel.

8.title: Freezing PEIA employee premiums for three years
8.description: The purpose of this bill is to freeze PEIA employee premiums for three years.

9.title: Relating to penalties incurred from obstructing, fleeing from and making false statements to law-enforcement
9.description: The purpose of this bill is to amend the penalties for several of the violations under this section to make it clear that the convicted person may be fined and confined.Â The offenses include obstructing, fleeing from and making false statements to law-enforcement, probation and parole officers and interfering with emergency communications.

10.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
10.title: Relating to public health

11.title: Changing the way that the costs of incarcerating inmates in regional jails is collected
11.description: The purpose of this bill is to relieve the burden imposed on counties of incarcerating inmates in regional jails by changing the way that the cost of incarcerating inmates is collected so that it is shared by the state and county and municipality where the alleged criminal act occurs; to reduce the cost of incarceration for less than twenty-four hours to one-half the daily per diem charge; and to obligate the state to pay for regional jail operations, including labor and associated expenses.

12.title: Creating a criminal felony offense of aggravated assault or battery of a child or a person who is mentally incapacitated
12.description: The purpose of this bill is to create a criminal felony offense of aggravated assault or battery of a child or a person who is mentally incapacitated.

13.title: Providing one-time supplements to all annuitants when they reach the age of seventy
13.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide for a supplement of three percent to be paid to all annuitants of the Public Employees Retirement and Teachers Retirement Systems at the time they reach the age of seventy.

14.title: Providing a maximum repair cost for insured owners of motor vehicles if a collision with a deer caused the damage
14.description: Providing a maximum repair cost for insured owners of motor vehicles if a collision with a deer caused the damage

15.title: Providing for the transfer of ownership, operation and maintenance of certain assets of the West Virginia Parkways Authority to the Division of Highways
15.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide for the transfer of ownership, operation and maintenance of certain assets of the West Virginia parkways authority, including the road now known as the West Virginia Turnpike to the Division of Highways. The bill also provides for the termination of the Parkways Authority after transfer of all of its assets to the Division of Highways on June 30, 2020.

16.title: Relating to the venue for suits and other actions against the state
16.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow a pro se plaintiff or petitioner to file a claim or petition against the state, a state officer, or state agency in the circuit court of a county in which the plaintiff or petitioner resides or in which a claim arose.

17.title: Permitting counties to adopt certain ordinances relating to dogs and cats
17.description: Permitting counties to adopt certain ordinances relating to dogs and cats

18.title: Eliminating the requirement that proceedings against the State, a state agency or state officer be brought and prosecuted in the circuit court of Kanawha County
18.description: The purpose of this bill is to repeal §14-2-2 of the West Virginia Code and to eliminate the requirement that proceedings against the State, a state agency or state officer be brought and prosecuted in the circuit court of Kanawha County.

19.title: Eliminating requirements that state provide for professional training and development of teachers
19.description: The purpose of this bill is to eliminate state payment for teacher and principal training, and to require that the money saved be directed to the Public Employees Insurance Agency. Â Professional development in public schools shall be optional and at the discretion of county school boards.

20.last_action: To House Agriculture and Natural Resources
20.title: Permitting the resident lineal descendants of landowners to hunt, trap or fish on that resident landowner's property without a license
20.description: Permitting the resident lineal descendants of landowners to hunt, trap or fish on that resident landowner's property without a license

21.title: Relating to county budget stabilization funds
21.description: The purpose of this bill is to require that a county itemize and publish all activity related to budget stabilization funds in the county's annual financial statements.

22.last_action: To House Small Business, Entrepreneurship and Economic Development
22.title: Establishing a tax credit for new businesses that locate in the state
22.description: Establishing a tax credit for new businesses that locate in the state

23.title: Relating to pension benefits exempt from state income taxation
23.description: The purpose of this bill is to treat natural resources police like all other law enforcement and exempt their pension benefits from state income tax.

24.title: Placing penalty points on driver’s licenses for using electronic communications devices while operating a motor vehicle
24.description: The purpose of this bill is to place penalty points on driver’s licenses for using electronic communications devices while operating a motor vehicle.

25.last_action: To House Agriculture and Natural Resources
25.title: Relating to the Senior Farmers' Market Nutrition Program
25.description: The purpose of this bill is to develop a Senior Farmers' Market Nutrition Program Fund within the Department of Agriculture. The bill also asks that the state consider adding an additional $30 to the $20 in vouchers that eligible seniors received in 2010.

26.title: Giving the Insurance Commissioner the power to regulate and penalize self-insured employers
26.description: The purpose of this bill is to grant the Insurance Commissioner the power to regulate and penalize self-insured employers. The bill also permits noncompliant employers to be compliant without penalty within ninety days after receiving notice of noncompliance.Â The bill also provides for monetary penalties.

27.title: Requiring county boards of education to provide released time for professional educators and service personnel when serving in an elected municipal or county office
27.description: Requiring county boards of education to provide released time for professional educators and service personnel when serving in an elected municipal or county office

28.last_action: To House Agriculture and Natural Resources
28.title: Increasing compensation for conservation officers
28.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide an increase in compensation for conservation officers.

29.title: Providing meetings and conference rights for members of municipal fire departments
29.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide meetings and conference rights for members of municipal fire departments. The bill also creates duties for the firefighters' Civil Service Commissions.

30.title: Providing for career development and establishing a pay scale for Alcohol Beverage Commission inspectors, enforcement agents and supervisors
30.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide a system for career development and establish a pay scale for Alcohol Beverage Commission inspectors, enforcement agents and supervisors.

31.title: Allowing state employees to take paid leave to attend parent-teacher conference for their children
31.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow state employees to take paid leave to attend parent-teacher conferences for their children.

32.title: Authorizing insurance to married workers without children at reduced rates under the West Virginia Public Employees Insurance Act
32.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize insurance to married workers without children at reduced rates under the West Virginia Public Employees Insurance Act.

33.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
33.title: Requiring facilities providing abortions to obtain parental notification or consent in writing
33.description: The purpose of this bill is to require facilities providing abortions to obtain parental notification or consent in writing by the parent or by a notarized signature of the parent; and providing a fine on the first offense of ten times the amount of the abortion and upon a subsequent offense closure of the facility for thirty days.

34.title: Including volunteer firefighters within the Public Employees Insurance Act
34.description: The purpose of this bill is to include volunteer firefighters within the Public Employees Insurance Act and require the county commissions to pay either three-fourths or the full amount of premiums.

35.title: Providing for the use of neck braces by football players
35.description: The purpose of this bill is to require the West Virginia Secondary School Activities Commission to adopt rules to provide for use of neck braces by all football players in interscholastic athletic football events.

36.title: Increasing benefits of retired state personnel and retired teachers
36.description: Increasing benefits of retired state personnel and retired teachers

37.title: Prohibiting the use of a credit score in casualty insurance rate filings
37.description: Prohibiting the use of a credit score in casualty insurance rate filings

38.last_action: To House Agriculture and Natural Resources
38.title: Providing a ten percent discount to residents at state parks and forests
38.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide a ten percent discount to West Virginia residents for lodging, camping and other recreation activities at state parks and forests.

39.title: Relating to inspection of vehicles and providing that defects in windshields and windows that do not obscure vision are not unsafe conditions
39.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide that defects in windshields and windows that do not obscure vision are not unsafe conditions preventing a vehicle from passing state inspection.

40.title: Extending the expiration of driver's licenses for active military members' spouses
40.description: Extending the expiration of driver's licenses for active military members' spouses

41.title: Defining the term minor boundary adjustment
41.description: The purpose of this bill is to define the term “minor boundary adjustment.”

42.title: Requiring all local special elections to be held on the days and hours of general, primary or state-wide elections
42.description: Requiring all local special elections to be held on the days and hours of general, primary or state-wide elections

43.last_action: To House Agriculture and Natural Resources
43.title: Providing a fee discount for certain nonresident hunting, fishing and trapping licenses for native nonresidents
43.description: Providing a fee discount for certain nonresident hunting, fishing and trapping licenses for native nonresidents

44.title: Relating to the transfer of certain revenues derived from lottery activities generally, restoring distribution to the West Virginia Infrastructure Fund to 2013 rates and decreasing the funds available for grants therefrom
44.description: The purpose of this bill is to restore distribution to the West Virginia Infrastructure Fund to 2013 rates; restore the amount that may be transferred to the Racetrack Modernization Fund to 2013 rates and decrease the funds available for grants therefrom; eliminate certain statutory distributions to the State Excess Lottery Revenue Fund; restore statutory distributions to capital reinvestment, purse funds and development funds to 2013 rates; and eliminate the statutory authorization for distributions to be paid on a pro rata basis.

45.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
45.title: Operating and maintaining a fully interoperable statewide network to facilitate public and private use of health care information in the state
45.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the board of directors of the West Virginia Health Information Network and the West Virginia Health Care Authority to determine and, with the approval of the Joint Committee on Government and Finance, to implement the most efficient and cost effective method for providing an interoperable health information network, which may include transferring the assets and liabilities of the current health information network to a private nonprofit corporation.

46.title: Relating to qualifying children of state employees, receiving income of $25,000 per year or less, for the West Virginia Children's Health Insurance Program
46.description: The purpose of this bill is to qualify children of state employees, receiving income of $25,000 per year or less, for the West Virginia Children's Health Insurance Program.

47.title: Making available elective courses on the history of the old and new testaments of the bible
47.description: The purpose of this bill is to make available elective courses of instruction in all schools located within this state on the history of the Old and New Testaments of the Bible.

49.title: Providing the Auditor with greater oversight of advance allowance accounts
49.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide the Auditor with greater oversight of advance allowance accounts. The bill also authorizes rule-making.

50.title: Establishing the Legislative Oversight Commission on Energy Workers Safety
50.description: mso-bidi-theme-font:minor-bidi'>The purpose of this bill is to establish a Legislative Oversight Commission on Energy Workers’ Safety to:  (1) Direct certain state agencies and boards to report regularly to the commission; to direct the commission to study worker safety in the mining and gas extraction industries; (2) Provide a mechanism for the Legislature to be kept informed and to study and identify issues and solutions for workers’ safety; and  (3) Require the commission to study and report on whether a need exists for expansion of safety regulations within the gas extraction industry.

51.title: West Virginia Native American Tribes Unique Recognition, Authentication and Listing Act
51.description: The purpose of this bill is to create the West Virginia Native American Tribes Unique Recognition, Authentication and Listing Act.

52.title: Making special registration plates for volunteer fire fighters
52.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow the issuance of a special volunteer fire fighter registration plate for a five-year period.

53.title: Increasing the amount of annual and incremental salary increases for eligible state employees
53.description: The purpose of this bill is to increase the amount of annual and incremental salary increases for eligible employees from $60 to $100 and to change eligibility criteria from three years of service to one.

54.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
54.title: Prohibiting state funding of abortions
54.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit state funding of abortions.

55.title: Requiring the assessor of each county to, within three months of a deed filing in the county clerk's office of each county, prepare a new property tax ticket
55.description: The purpose of this bill is to require the assessor of each county to, within three months of a deed filing in the county clerk's office of each county, prepare a new property tax ticket and cause the tax ticket to be mailed, from the county sheriff's office, to the new property owner to avoid any lapse in which the new property owner may otherwise incur in paying property taxes.

56.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
56.title: Ensuring Patient Safety Act

57.title: Allowing the Executive Director of the West Virginia Regional Jail and Correctional Facility Authority to establish a work program
57.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow the Executive Director of the West Virginia Regional Jail and Correctional Facility Authority to establish a work program for qualified inmates sentenced to a regional jail facility. It includes provisions specifying minimum requirements for the program.

58.title: Prohibiting blasting within six hundred twenty-five feet of an occupied dwelling
58.description: Â The purpose of this bill is to extend the distance from occupied dwellings or certain other structures in which surface mine production blasting may not occur, to be consistent with the distance a gas well drilling pad must be from an occupied dwelling.

59.title: Establishing a bill of rights for children in foster care
59.description: The purpose of this bill is to establish a bill of rights for children in foster care.

60.title: Establishing a bill of rights for foster parents
60.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide a bill of rights for foster parents.

61.title: Increasing the minimum number of magisterial districts in a county
61.description: The purpose of this bill is to increase the minimum number of magisterial districts in a county from three to four.

62.title: Exempting personal income earned by individuals working as teachers at primary and secondary schools from personal income tax
62.description: Exempting personal income earned by individuals working as teachers at primary and secondary schools from personal income tax

63.title: Home Instruction Tax Relief Act
63.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow a taxpayer a personal income tax credit for each dependent that participated in home educational instruction for the most recent academic year.

64.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
64.title: Relating to the rule-making authority of local boards of health
64.description: The purpose of this bill is to establish a procedure by which a local governing body may review and vote upon the adoption, amendment or revocation of existing local board of health rules and to require that a governing body officially adopt all proposed local board of health rules by a majority vote before any new rule may be enforced.

65.title: Exempting commercial airlines from obtaining licenses to serve liquor, beer or wine on flights
65.description: The purpose of this bill is to exempt commercial airlines from the licensing requirements of the state to serve liquor, beer or wine on flights.

66.title: Requiring the issuance of a search warrant before a driver of a motor vehicle can be made to submit to a secondary blood test
66.description: The purpose of this bill is to require a search warrant be issued before a driver of a motor vehicle can be made to submit to a secondary blood test to determine the concentration of alcohol or controlled substance in his or her blood.

67.title: Defining the act of leaving the scene of a crash involving death or serious bodily injury as a felony; Erin's Law
67.description: The purpose of this bill is to define the act of leaving the scene of a crash involving death or serious bodily injury as a felony. The bill also establishes certain presumptions of knowledge based on the circumstances of a vehicle crash.

68.last_action: To House Veterans' Affairs and Homeland Security
68.title: Recognizing those in active military service as residents for the purpose of obtaining concealed carry permits while stationed at a West Virginia military installation
68.description: Recognizing those in active military service as residents for the purpose of obtaining concealed carry permits while stationed at a West Virginia military installation

69.title: Relating to the juvenile justice reform oversight committee
69.description: Relating to the juvenile justice reform oversight committee

70.title: Allowing a group of affiliated voters to become a recognized political party under certain criteria
70.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow a group to become a recognized political party if the group’s candidate receives one percent of the votes in an election for any one of six statewide offices, including that of Governor, Secretary of State, Treasurer, Auditor, Attorney General or Commissioner of Agriculture; to allow a group of affiliated voters to become a recognized political party if five thousand or more individuals have identified as a member of the group on their current voter registration forms; and to require voting registration forms to provide a space for individuals who do not select a political party affiliation to write the name of a group of affiliated of voters to which they belong.

71.title: Making changes to the definition of contractor for purposes of the West Virginia Contractor Licensing Act
71.description: The purpose of this bill is to raise the threshold amount required for a construction job to be performed by someone with a contractor's license from $2,500 to $4,000.

72.title: Requiring that public schools provide facilities for students of all faiths and religions to have a place of fellowship, prayer and worship
72.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide that the State Board of Education require that public schools provide facilities for students of all faiths and religions to have a place of fellowship, prayer and worship.

73.title: Establishing the state parks instant lottery scratch-off game
73.description: The purpose of this bill is to establish within the West Virginia Lottery the State Parks Benefit Game, and to establish within the State Treasury the State Parks Lottery Fund.

75.title: Requiring school bus aides, who are trained in preventing bullying and providing a safe environment for students while being transported on a school bus, to be present on school buses
75.description: Requiring school bus aides, who are trained in preventing bullying and providing a safe environment for students while being transported on a school bus, to be present on school buses

76.title: Increasing the amount of retirement income to be excluded from the gross income of individuals receiving retirement benefits under the West Virginia Public Employees Retirement System
76.description: The purpose of this bill is to increase from $2,000 to $20,000 the amount of retirement income to be excluded from the gross income of individuals receiving retirement benefits under the West Virginia Public Employees Retirement System and the West Virginia State Teachers Retirement System. The bill also provides an effective date.

77.title: Exempting certified professional estimator services from consumer sales and service tax
77.description: color:windowtext'>The purpose of this bill is to exempt certified professional estimator services from consumer sales and service tax.Â The bill provides a definition.

78.last_action: To House Veterans' Affairs and Homeland Security
78.title: Exempting all monetary benefits derived from military retirement from personal income tax obligations
78.description: The purpose of this bill is to exempt all monetary benefits derived from military retirement from personal income tax obligations.

79.title: Providing a procedure for West Virginia to select delegates to an Article V convention for proposing amendments to the Constitution of the United States of America
79.description: Providing a procedure for West Virginia to select delegates to an Article V convention for proposing amendments to the Constitution of the United States of America

80.title: Prohibiting sexual offenders from residing within one thousand feet of a school or childcare facility
80.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit sexual offenders from residing within one thousand feet of a school or childcare facility. The bill requires persons, as a condition of probation, parole or supervised release, convicted of sexual crimes against a minor be subject to global positional system monitoring for life. The bill also provides for a felony penalty.

81.title: Removing the requirement that home schooled students have to acquire a general equivalency degree (GED) in order to qualify for the promise scholarship
81.description: The purpose of this bill is to remove the requirement that home schooled students have to acquire a general equivalency degree (GED) in order to be eligible to receive a PROMISE scholarship.

82.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
82.title: West Virginia Residential Furniture and Children's Products Flame Retardants Act
82.description: The purpose of this bill is to create the West Virginia Residential Furniture and Children's Products Flame Retardants Act administered and enforced under the authority of the Commissioner of the Bureau for Public Health.Â The bill prohibits the use of certain flame-retardant chemicals in certain products, including those designed for use by children. The bill states when replacement chemicals may be used in these product and provides exemptions to requirements.Â The bill requires a report to the Joint Committee on Government and Finance by the Commissioner of the Bureau for Public Health in conjunction with the Fire Marshal.Â The bill requires certificates of compliance from persons or businesses selling products subject to this article, provides for injunctive relief for violations and provides for civil penalties.

83.title: Providing a tax credit for first time home buyers
83.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide a tax credit for first time home buyers. The bill establishes eligibility criteria and sets a maximum credit of $5,000.

84.title: Making the West Virginia Schools for the Deaf and Blind eligible to participate in any and all funding administered or distributed by the West Virginia School Building Authority
84.description: Making the West Virginia Schools for the Deaf and Blind eligible to participate in any and all funding administered or distributed by the West Virginia School Building Authority

85.title: Providing that members of the House of Delegates in districts having more than one delegate be elected from numbered divisions
85.description: Providing that members of the House of Delegates in districts having more than one delegate be elected from numbered divisions

86.title: Reinstating service credit to certain members of the Public Employees Retirement System
86.description: Reinstating service credit to certain members of the Public Employees Retirement System

88.last_action: To House Small Business, Entrepreneurship and Economic Development
88.title: Requiring persons who are in the business of purchasing precious metals and precious gems to photograph those purchases and to transmit the photographs to law-enforcement
88.description: Requiring persons who are in the business of purchasing precious metals and precious gems to photograph those purchases and to transmit the photographs to law-enforcement

89.title: Relating to the powers and authority of state and local law enforcement to enforce underage drinking laws at private clubs
89.description: The purpose of this bill is to state the legal right and authority of state or local law enforcement to enter public areas on or adjacent to any private club, or take other appropriate police action to enforce the underage drinking laws of this state.

90.title: Relating to drug testing of legislators
90.description: The purpose of this bill is to require legislators to annually pass a drug test in order to receive any pay or expense reimbursement.

91.title: Prohibiting the state from requiring persons with oil or gas rights connected to deep oil or gas wells to involuntarily integrate their interests
91.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit the state from requiring persons with oil or gas rights connected to deep oil or gas wells to involuntarily integrate their interests in a drilling unit and to require a surface owner’s consent for operations or disturbances to the surface of the land in a drilling unit.

92.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
92.title: Limiting able-bodied adults without dependents receipt of SNAP benefits to three months in a thirty-six month period
92.description: Limiting able-bodied adults without dependents receipt of SNAP benefits to three months in a thirty-six month period

93.title: Permitting persons who are twenty-one years of age or older to operate or be a passenger on a motorcycle without a helmet
93.description: The purpose of this bill is to permit persons who are twenty-one years of age or older to operate or be a passenger on a motorcycle without a helmet if they have held a license valid for the operation of a motorcycle for a minimum of two years.

94.last_action: To House Veterans' Affairs and Homeland Security
94.title: Making it a misdemeanor for a person to impersonate a veteran
94.description: Making it a misdemeanor for a person to impersonate a veteran

95.title: Right to keep and bear arms
95.description: Right to keep and bear arms

96.title: Providing an exemption from regulation by the Public Service Commission for motor vehicles used exclusively in the transportation of roll-off solid waste containers
96.description: Providing an exemption from regulation by the Public Service Commission for motor vehicles used exclusively in the transportation of roll-off solid waste containers

97.title: Modifying the definition of child abuse or neglect to exclude accidental injury
97.description: Modifying the definition of child abuse or neglect to exclude accidental injury

98.title: Expanding the authority of motor carrier inspectors
98.description: The purpose of this bill is to extend the authority of law-enforcement officers to motor carrier inspectors when possession of a controlled substance, assault or battery is committed in the inspector's presence, and to expand the authority of inspectors to inspect vehicles.

99.title: Providing a salary increase for special education teachers
99.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide a salary increase for special education teachers.

100.title: Relating to relocation or closure of state higher education institutions
100.description: The purpose of this bill is to insure that closure or transfer of any publicly-funded higher education institution be preapproved by the Legislative Oversight Commission on Education Accountability (LOCEA); to require both an economic and educational study to be presented to the LOCEA before it may be closed or transferred; and to keep WVU-Tech in its current location in Montgomery.Â The bill makes clear that WVU-Tech may not be closed or transferred without LOCEA approval.

101.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
101.title: Repealing provision prohibiting employers from discriminating for use of tobacco products
101.description: The purpose of this bill is to repeal the provision prohibiting employers from discriminating for use of tobacco products.

102.title: Allowing a home improvement transaction to be performed under an oral contract
102.description: Allowing a home improvement transaction to be performed under an oral contract

103.title: Providing taxpayers repaying their own student loans a modification reducing federal adjusted gross in the amount of the interest paid
103.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide taxpayers repaying their own student loans a modification reducing federal adjusted gross income in the amount of the interest paid, for personal income tax purposes.

104.last_action: To House Veterans' Affairs and Homeland Security
104.title: Establishing a minimum number of troopers to provide basic law enforcement services, and providing members of the West Virginia State Police a $580 salary increase at the end of two years of service
104.description: The purpose of this bill is to establish a minimum number of troopers to provide basic law- enforcement services.Â The bill further provides that the salary increase at the end of two years of service for members of the West Virginia State Police will increase from $500 to $580.

105.last_action: To House Agriculture and Natural Resources
105.title: Relating to the hunting of coyotes
105.description: The purpose of this bill is to permit year-round hunting of coyotes using artificial light or night vision technology and to permit hunting of coyotes at any hour.

106.title: Relating to sanctions for recipients of benefits from the Temporary Assistance for Needy Families Program
106.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide sanctions for recipients of benefits from the temporary assistance for needy families program through temporary suspensions of benefits when they are convicted of misdemeanor theft offenses of shoplifting or petit larceny.Â The bill provides definitions.Â It establishes administrative review of decisions to deny benefits.Â The bill also provides a mechanism for dependent children to receive benefits if a parent is deemed ineligible.Â It authorizes rulemaking, providing penalties and allows for exceptions to providing sanctions.

107.title: Relating to career progression of members of the State Police
107.description: Relating to career progression of members of the State Police

108.title: Relating to certain members of the Legislature and certain service by members of the Legislature
108.description: The purpose of this bill is to address issues relating to the computation of legislative pensions.Â It provides for the calculation of benefits by averaging compensation received for all years of accumulated service.

109.title: Relating to school calendar
109.description: The purpose of this bill is to change the mandatory school instructional days from one hundred eighty days to minutes over a period of one hundred eighty days based upon the minimum amount of hours of instruction offered to students provided by state board rules.

110.title: Prohibiting drilling units from being established without consent of all owners
110.description: Prohibiting drilling units from being established without consent of all owners

111.title: The Healthy and Safe Workplace Act
111.description: The purpose of this bill is to create a new cause of action to deter workplace bullying. This bill makes it an unlawful employment practice to subject an employee to an abusive work environment that exists when the defendant, acting with malice, subjects an employee to abusive conduct so severe that it causes tangible harm to the employee. Further, this bill makes it an unlawful employment practice to retaliate in any manner against an employee who has made a charge, testified, assisted or participated in any manner against an employee who has made a charge, testified, assisted or participated in any manner in an investigation or proceeding regarding bullying in the workplace.

112.title: Providing that paid county or municipal fire departments and duly incorporated volunteer fire departments pay reduced workers' compensation premiums when not actively engaged in fire fighting
112.description: Providing that paid county or municipal fire departments and duly incorporated volunteer fire departments pay reduced workers' compensation premiums when not actively engaged in fire fighting

113.title: Relating to purchasing requirements for the Division of Highways
113.description: Relating to purchasing requirements for the Division of Highways

114.title: Exempting motor vehicles from personal property tax
114.description: The purpose of this bill is to exempt motor vehicles from personal property tax.

115.title: Abolishing the Personal Income Tax
115.description: The purpose of this bill is to abolish the personal income tax.

116.title: Prohibiting the placement of the name or likeness of public officials on state road signs
116.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit placement of the name or likeness of public officials on state road signs.

117.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
117.title: Relating to out of state physicians and surgeons traveling with sports teams within this state
117.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize a physician or surgeon who is traveling with a sports team and is licensed to practice medicine or osteopathic medicine in another state to provide medical care to sports team members under certain circumstances.

118.title: Requiring county boards of education to employ a certified library media specialist in each county school
118.description: Requiring county boards of education to employ a certified library media specialist in each county school

119.title: Prohibiting counties and municipalities from adopting ordinances or regulations that base restrictions on the breed of a dog
119.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit municipalities and counties from enacting ordinances or regulations that base restrictions on the breed of a dog.

120.title: Clarifying that the county or regional solid waste authority that may impose and collect an additional solid waste assessment fee is the county or region where the waste originates
120.description: Clarifying that the county or regional solid waste authority that may impose and collect an additional solid waste assessment fee is the county or region where the waste originates

121.title: Relating generally to horizontal well control standards
121.description: Relating generally to horizontal well control standards

122.title: Permitting contractors to perform work on a construction project without having a contractor’s license under certain circumstances
122.description: The purpose of this bill is to permit contractors to perform work on a construction project without having a contractor’s license when the total cost of that project is less than $5,000.

123.title: Providing that school nutrition plans include take home meals for low income students
123.description: The purpose of this bill is to require that school nutrition plans include take home meals for low income students or any student who requests take home meals.

124.last_action: To House Veterans' Affairs and Homeland Security
124.title: Providing benefits for those who have served in the military service
124.description: Providing benefits for those who have served in the military service

125.title: Granting all public employees, all teachers, all service employees, all public employee retirees, all teacher retirees and all service employee retirees a $1,000 per year permanent pay increase
125.description: Granting all public employees, all teachers, all service employees, all public employee retirees, all teacher retirees and all service employee retirees a $1,000 per year permanent pay increase

126.title: Requiring recipients of Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program be issued a photo identification card
126.description: Requiring recipients of Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program be issued a photo identification card

127.title: Prohibiting the number of inquiries reflected in a credit report, credit score report or CLUE report from adversely affecting an application for insurance
127.description: The purpose of this bill is to limit the use of a credit score to banking institution credit scoring for casualty insurance rate filings; to prohibit the use of credit scoring as a consideration in calculating insurance rates in homeowners or automobile liability policies; and to prohibit the number of inquiries reflected in a credit report, credit score report or CLUE report from adversely affecting an application for insurance; and, prohibiting reliance on information which is false or potentially false.

128.last_action: To House Agriculture and Natural Resources
128.title: Exempting all veterans of the Armed Forces or any reserve component thereof from having to obtain a hunting, trapping fishing license
128.description: Exempting all veterans of the Armed Forces or any reserve component thereof from having to obtain a hunting, trapping fishing license

129.title: Relating to quarterly payment of real and personal property taxes
129.description: Relating to quarterly payment of real and personal property taxes

130.title: Issuing a special registration plate for persons who are residents of this state and who have a family member diagnosed with autism spectrum disorder
130.description: Issuing a special registration plate for persons who are residents of this state and who have a family member diagnosed with autism spectrum disorder

131.title: Creating an additional magistrate court deputy clerk position for Marion County
131.description: The purpose of this bill is to create a new magistrate court deputy clerk position for Marion County.

132.title: Continuing personal income tax adjustment to gross income of certain retirees receiving pensions from defined pension plans
132.description: The purpose of this bill is to continue providing a personal income tax adjustment to the gross income of certain retirees receiving pensions from defined pension plans that terminated and are being paid a reduced maximum benefit guarantee.

133.title: Permitting teachers under the State Teachers Retirement System to teach college level courses without loss of benefits
133.description: The purpose of this bill is to permit retired public school teachers to teach college level courses without loss of retirement benefits.

134.title: Giving local authorities the authority to decrease the speed limit on streets and highways where school buses travel in its jurisdiction
134.description: Arial;color:windowtext'>The purpose of this bill is to give local authorities the authority to decrease the speed limit on streets and highways where school buses travel.Â The bill provides that no lowering of a speed limit is effective until approved by the Commissioner of Highways.

135.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
135.title: Establishing an advisory council on rare diseases
135.description: The purpose of this bill is to create an advisory council to educate the public and the medical community in the recognition, diagnosis, treatment and research of rare diseases.

136.last_action: To House Agriculture and Natural Resources
136.title: Exempting disabled veterans from campground rental fees during certain times
136.description: The purpose of this bill is to exempt disabled veterans from campground rental fees from the day after Labor day until four days prior to Memorial Day.Â The bill provides rule-making authority.

137.title: Relating to educational benefits for dependents of deceased or disabled veterans
137.description: The purpose of this bill is to require state institutions of higher education to waive tuition and fees for children and spouses of National Guard members and members of a Reserve component of the Armed Forces of the United States or persons on federal or state active military duty who are residents of this state and who have suffered a hundred percent total and permanent service-connected disability.

138.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
138.title: Adding pharmacist and pharmacy to the definition of "health care provider" as used in the Medical Professional Liability Act
138.description: Adding pharmacist and pharmacy to the definition of "health care provider" as used in the Medical Professional Liability Act

139.title: Relating to the West Virginia Future Fund
139.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit deposits into the West Virginia Future Fund in years when certain state retirement systems are not funded to ninety percent or more of their actuarial accrued liabilities.

140.title: Reducing personnel employed by the West Virginia Department of Education
140.description: Reducing personnel employed by the West Virginia Department of Education

141.title: Requiring retail establishments offering gasoline or other motor fuel to provide refueling assistance and refueling access to persons with a disability
141.description: The purpose of this bill is to require retail establishments offering gasoline or other motor fuel to provide refueling assistance and refueling access to persons with a disability, to establish requirements and exceptions, to provide the Secretary of the Department of Transportation with enforcement and rule-making authority and to establish penalties for noncompliance.

142.title: Redirecting certain funds of the West Virginia Department of Education
142.description: The purpose of this bill is to require the West Virginia Department of Education to transfer an amount equal to one half of the department’s 2017 budget for administrative costs into a special account for the purpose of increasing teacher salaries.

143.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
143.title: Save the Hospitals Act
143.description: The purpose of this bill is to create the Save the Hospitals Act; exempting nonprofit hospitals that provide a certain amount of uncompensated care from sales tax and requiring West Virginia Hospital Finance Authority to promulgate rules to effectuate this section.

144.title: Requiring the Human Rights Commission, when investigating a complaint of discrimination, to specifically include an examination of the intent of the person
144.description: Requiring the Human Rights Commission, when investigating a complaint of discrimination, to specifically include an examination of the intent of the person

145.title: Removing limitations on advertising and promotional activities by limited video lottery retailers
145.description: The purpose of this bill is to remove the limitations on advertising and promotional activities by limited video lottery retailers.

146.title: Exempting heating oil for residential use from the Motor Fuel Excise Tax
146.description: The purpose of this bill is to exempt heating oil used for residential purposes from the Motor Fuel Excise Tax.

148.title: Authorizing counties and municipalities to establish a joint airport hazard comprehensive plan
148.description: Authorizing counties and municipalities to establish a joint airport hazard comprehensive plan

149.title: Limiting the authority of municipalities to regulate the purchasing, possessing, transferring, owning, carrying, transporting, selling and storing of knives
149.description: Limiting the authority of municipalities to regulate the purchasing, possessing, transferring, owning, carrying, transporting, selling and storing of knives

150.title: Increasing pay to teachers and service personnel
150.description: The purpose of this bill is to increase pay to teachers and service personnel by two percent the first year, two percent the second and one percent in the third year.

151.last_action: Motion to take motion to discharge from the table rejected (Roll No. 41)
151.title: Increasing salaries for teachers

153.title: Relating to compulsory school attendance
153.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide that five unexcused occasions on which a student is tardy for school may equal one unexcused absence.

154.title: West Virginia Educational Restoration Act
154.description: The purpose of this bill is to discontinue and prohibit the use of Common Core academic content standards; to adopt alternative academic content standards; to discontinue the use of common core based assessments; to establish a committee and process for developing alternate statewide assessments of student progress; to prohibit the state board or any public school from sharing student data without parental consent; and to prohibit acceptance of federal funding if such funding is conditioned upon sharing student data without parental consent.

155.title: Issuing identification documents to homeless individuals residing at homeless shelters
155.description: The purpose of this bill is to require the Division of Motor Vehicles to provide certain identification documents to homeless individuals, residing at homeless shelters within this state, at no cost.

156.title: Making individuals responsible for the costs relating to the filing of excessive false complaints
156.description: The purpose of this bill is to make individuals responsible for the costs relating to the filing of excessive false complaints with state agencies and departments.

157.title: Increasing the maximum personal income tax exemption for persons over the age of sixty-five and for persons who are totally disabled
157.description: The purpose of this bill is to raise the maximum personal income tax exemption for persons over the age of sixty-five and for persons who are totally disabled from $8,000 to $16,000.

158.title: Prohibiting chairmen of state political parties during or up to one year after the termination of their employment as chairmen of those political parties from registering as lobbyists
158.description: Prohibiting chairmen of state political parties during or up to one year after the termination of their employment as chairmen of those political parties from registering as lobbyists

159.title: Relating to gasoline and fuel excise tax
159.description: The purpose of this bill is to require a refund of gasoline or fuel excise tax when fuel is consumed by a commercial vehicle while that vehicle is not operated upon the highways of this state.

160.title: Relating to the issuance, expiration and renewal of driver’s license
160.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide that the license of any person who is working on behalf of West Virginia or the United States out of the United States does not expire until six months after that person returns to West Virginia.Â The bill also provides that the driver’s license of family members of persons in the Armed Forces of the United States do not expire until six months after separation from the service by the military member.

161.title: Establishing new procedures for courts with criminal jurisdiction to suspend and revoke driver’s licenses based on D.U.I.
161.description: Establishing new procedures for courts with criminal jurisdiction to suspend and revoke driver’s licenses based on D.U.I.

162.title: Discontinuing the use of common core standards and assessments in the state
162.description: Discontinuing the use of common core standards and assessments in the state

163.title: Requiring regional airport authority board members to include persons of area expertise
163.description: Requiring regional airport authority board members to include persons of area expertise

164.title: Making all future federal and local statutes, ordinances, laws, orders and rules concerning firearms, firearm accessories, ammunition and their accouterments invalid and unenforceable
164.description: Making all future federal and local statutes, ordinances, laws, orders and rules concerning firearms, firearm accessories, ammunition and their accouterments invalid and unenforceable

165.title: Removing the compensation caps entirely for secretary-clerks and case coordinators
165.description: Removing the compensation caps entirely for secretary-clerks and case coordinators

166.last_action: To House Veterans' Affairs and Homeland Security
166.title: Requiring the Superintendent of the State Police to implement a plan to increase the number of troopers
166.description: The purpose of this bill is to require the Superintendent of the State Police to develop a plan to increase the number of troopers to a minimum of eight hundred by July 1, 2018.

167.title: Establishing a retired teachers instant lottery scratch-off game
167.description: Establishing a retired teachers instant lottery scratch-off game

168.title: Allowing nonmembers of a political party to request that party’s partisan ballot at a primary election
168.description: The purpose of this bill is to require notification to voters at polling places in primary elections that they may request and use a ballot for one of the major political parties if the voter is not affiliated with any party or if the voter is registered with a party that does not have candidates on a ballot for that polling area. This codifies the process that has been in place allowing nonmembers of a political party to request that party’s partisan ballot at a primary election.

169.title: Requiring private clubs to be closed from two o'clock a.m. to seven o'clock a.m. on weekdays
169.description: Requiring private clubs to be closed from two o'clock a.m. to seven o'clock a.m. on weekdays

170.title: Prohibiting sex offender registrants from having Halloween related contact with children
170.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit sex offender registrants from having Halloween related contact with children.Â The bill also provides a misdemeanor criminal penalty for violations.

171.title: Exempting social security benefits from personal income tax
171.description: Exempting social security benefits from personal income tax

172.title: Requiring that patching repair of hard surfaced roads, highways and streets be by use of mechanical rollers
172.description: color:windowtext'>The purpose of this bill is to require that patching repair of hard surfaced roads, highways and streets be by use of mechanical rollers for smoother final repair unless an emergency situation requires a different method.

173.title: Limiting supervision of laying of lines on state rights-of-way
173.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit the state from requiring a public service district to have a state engineer on site during the entire construction period of projects on state rights-of-way.

174.title: West Virginia Earned Income Tax Credit
174.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide an earned income tax credit against the personal income tax.

175.title: Protecting consumers from surprise bills by health care providers
175.description: Protecting consumers from surprise bills by health care providers

176.title: Exempting Class X vehicles from the tax provisions of this section
176.description: The purpose of this bill is to exempt certain vehicles used in farming (Class X vehicles) from the tax imposed upon the privilege of effecting the certification of title of a motor vehicle.

177.last_action: To House Prevention and Treatment of Substance Abuse
177.title: Prohibiting the sale of paraphernalia designed or marketed for use with controlled substances
177.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit sale of paraphernalia designed or marketed for use with controlled substances.

178.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
178.title: Raising the legal age for purchase of tobacco and tobacco products
178.description: Raising the legal age for purchase of tobacco and tobacco products

179.title: Requiring the Library Commission to survey the libraries of the state and develop a ten year plan for construction and maintenance of public libraries
179.description: Requiring the Library Commission to survey the libraries of the state and develop a ten year plan for construction and maintenance of public libraries

180.title: Relating to school curricular standards and assessments
180.description: Relating to school curricular standards and assessments

181.title: Protecting academic freedom in higher education
181.description: Protecting academic freedom in higher education

182.title: Reducing the number of pupils per school nurses
182.description: The purpose of this bill is to reduce the ratio of pupils to school nurses employed by county boards of education from one per every 1,500 pupils in K through seventh grade to one per every 1,000 pupils.

184.title: Relating to performance metrics for the West Virginia Division of Highways
184.description: The purpose of this bill is to require the West Virginia Division of Highways to develop performance standards and criteria to measure agency performance in all essential operations and to require the division to employ a management information system that will track the division’s past and current progress toward meeting performance standards.

185.title: Deleting the language that remitted a portion of the alcoholic beverage tax to municipalities
185.description: The purpose of this bill is to give all taxes collected for sales of alcoholic beverages outside municipal limits to the counties only.

186.title: Relating to the criminal offense of desecration of graves and vandalizing cemeteries
186.description: The purpose of this bill is to mandate that anyone who desecrates a grave or vandalizes a cemetery shall perform one thousand hours of service to the cemetery involved in the offense.

187.title: Requiring the Commissioner of Highways to develop a formula for allocating road funds among districts
187.description: The purpose of this bill is to require the Commissioner of Highways to develop a formula for allocating road funds among districts, for the benefit of the counties; to make legislative findings; to require the commissioner to solicit and consider public comments; to require the commissioner to consider certain factors when developing the formula; and to require the commissioner to submit the formula to the Legislature for approval as a legislative rule.

188.title: Requiring the Commissioner of Highways to develop a statewide communications plan known as the Comprehensive Public Involvement Plan
188.description: Requiring the Commissioner of Highways to develop a statewide communications plan known as the Comprehensive Public Involvement Plan

189.title: Repealing the West Virginia Workplace Freedom Act and restoring prior law
189.description: The purpose of this bill is to repeal the Workplace Freedom Act of 2016 and restore the prior provisions of the Labor-Management Relations Act.

190.title: Relating to the approval of the Historic Landmarks Commission
190.description: The purpose of this bill is to require the approval of the Historic Landmarks Commission for certain Municipal Planning Commission projects within a historic district designated by listing on the National Register of Historic Places.

191.title: Relating to the power of local government authorities to regulate vehicular traffic within their borders
191.description: Relating to the power of local government authorities to regulate vehicular traffic within their borders

192.title: Exempting a percentage of social security benefits from personal income tax
192.description: The purpose of this bill is to exempt a percentage of social security benefits from personal income tax based on individual's overall amount of taxable income.

193.title: Relating to the surcharge on fire and casualty insurance policies
193.description: Relating to the surcharge on fire and casualty insurance policies

194.last_action: To House Agriculture and Natural Resources
194.title: Relating to the beginning and expiration of hunting and fishing licenses
194.description: The purpose of this bill is to change the beginning and expiration of hunting and fishing licenses from the last day of the calendar year for which they were issued to the last day of the month the licensee was born.

195.title: Requiring that a state employee with a commercial driver’s license have a current medical evaluation certification
195.description: Requiring that a state employee with a commercial driver’s license have a current medical evaluation certification

196.title: Relating to outdoor advertising regulated by the Commissioner of Highways
196.description: Relating to outdoor advertising regulated by the Commissioner of Highways

197.title: Relating to candidates for professional employee positions involving supervision of a county transportation department
197.description: Relating to candidates for professional employee positions involving supervision of a county transportation department

198.title: Restoring the ability of new hires to use accrued annual and sick leave for retirement service credit
198.description: The purpose of this bill is to restore the ability of new hires to use accrued annual and sick leave for retirement service credit.

199.title: Relating to consumer protection of new manufactured home warranties
199.description: The purpose of this bill is to place upon the manufacturers of manufactured homes the duty to meet their obligations and responsibilities under the terms of the express warranties extended to the consumers in this state. The bill provides consumers additional remedies to enforce the warranties.

200.title: Reestablishing prevailing wages for certain state government contracts
200.description: The purpose of this bill is to restore prevailing wages for certain government contracts to state law.Â This bill reinstates the Prevailing Wage Law that was in effect until its repeal in 2016.

201.title: Requiring schools post signs displaying the Childhelp National Child Abuse Hotline
201.description: The purpose of this bill is to require schools to post signs displaying the Childhelp National Child Abuse Hotline number.

202.last_action: To House Small Business, Entrepreneurship and Economic Development
202.title: Establishing a Small Business Empowerment and Economic Expansion Program providing tax relief to newly-established small businesses
202.description: The purpose of this bill is to create a program to provide tax relief to new businesses that hire West Virginia residents as at least fifty percent of their employees. The program allows new, small businesses and business owners to be taxed at an effective rate of one percent on income derived from the business and to receive a credit against business and occupation taxes and business franchise taxes equal to the amount of property tax paid during the tax year for the tangible personal property of the business (equipment, durable goods and business inventory.)

203.last_action: To House Veterans' Affairs and Homeland Security
203.title: Requiring an official declaration of war or an action to call forth the West Virginia National Guard by the United States Congress
203.description: Requiring an official declaration of war or an action to call forth the West Virginia National Guard by the United States Congress

204.title: Providing school days to register and transport students to vote
204.description: The purpose of this bill is to require county boards of education to provide days prior to early voting during primary, general and special elections for registering eligible students to vote and for the transportation of registered students to appropriate voting places during early voting periods.

205.title: Providing a special method for valuation of certain wireless technology property for property taxes
205.description: The purpose of this bill is to establish the Wireless Technology Business Property Valuation Act which provides for mandated salvage valuation for property tax purposes of tangible personal property directly used in certain wireless technology businesses.

206.title: Providing for the redistricting office of the Joint Committee on Government and Finance to propose redistricting plans during census years
206.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide for the Redistricting Office of the Joint Committee on Government and Finance to propose redistricting plans during census years. The main task of the Redistricting Office is to propose a plan to the Legislature which is based on Constitutional and legal requirements and considerations.Â The bill provides specific criteria that the redistricting office must observe in proposing district mappings. The bill requires the redistricting office to advertise a proposed draft map of districts to the public. The bill requires the redistricting office to recommend redistricting plan to the Legislature. The bill requires the full Legislature to vote on plan ratification. The bill provides for subsequent submissions of plans and vote by Legislature. The bill requires that the commission certify to the Secretary of State that its final proposal for district boundaries is in accordance with Constitutional and legal requirements. The bill prohibits certain persons from influencing or attempting to influence district mapping proposals of the redistricting office.

207.title: Reallocating and dedicating up to $30 million to the natural gas and oil severance tax revenues annually to the natural gas and oil-producing counties of origin
207.description: Reallocating and dedicating up to $30 million to the natural gas and oil severance tax revenues annually to the natural gas and oil-producing counties of origin

208.last_action: To House Veterans' Affairs and Homeland Security
208.title: Exempting recipients of the distinguished Purple Heart medal from payment of the vehicle registration fee
208.description: Exempting recipients of the distinguished Purple Heart medal from payment of the vehicle registration fee

209.title: Providing death penalty for first degree murder
209.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide for a death penalty and procedures and standards applicable thereto, and automatic review of the penalty, for commission of murder in the first degree.Â Procedures for carrying out the death sentence are established.

210.last_action: To House Agriculture and Natural Resources
210.title: Establishing an arborists program for inmates
210.description: The purpose of this bill is to train inmates as arborists and use them to inspect trees along state roads and highways for those in danger of falling onto the roads and highways.

212.title: Requiring the circuit court, when appointing counsel for alleged protected persons, to make appointments from a listing of all interested attorneys in the circuit
212.description: Requiring the circuit court, when appointing counsel for alleged protected persons, to make appointments from a listing of all interested attorneys in the circuit

213.title: Creating the West Virginia Earned Income Tax Credit
213.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide low and moderate income workers with a refundable state tax credit based on the federal earned income tax credit. Current law provides for a nonrefundable tax credit based on federal poverty guidelines.

214.title: Reducing federal adjusted gross income for volunteer fire department and rescue squad members
214.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow members of volunteer fire departments and rescue squads who have successfully completed required training and are covered by workers' compensation a $5,000 modification reducing federal adjusted gross income for personal income tax purposes.

215.title: Permitting county boards of education to accumulate instructional days and use them when needed
215.description: The purpose of this bill is to permit county boards of education to accumulate instructional days and use them when needed in a later instructional term when inclement weather and emergencies prevent the otherwise full instructional term from being completed. The bill establishes an instructional day to be three hundred thirty minutes.

216.last_action: To House Agriculture and Natural Resources
216.title: Providing an increase in compensation for natural resources police officers
216.description: Providing an increase in compensation for natural resources police officers

217.title: Requiring that State Police officers be compensated for time when they are required to be on standby and providing a stipend for housing cost for certain officers
217.description: The purpose of this bill is to require that State Police officers be compensated for time when they are required to be on standby so that they may be called back to work if necessary and to provide a stipend for housing cost for officers that reside in and are assigned to the highest five counties according to median monthly housing cost.

218.title: Relating to the death penalty for first degree murder
218.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide for a death penalty and procedures and standards applicable thereto, and automatic review of the penalty, for commission of murder in the first degree.Â Procedures for carrying out the death sentence are established.

221.title: Requiring the comprehensive annual financial report to be published by the end of December
221.description: The purpose of this bill is to require the comprehensive annual financial report to be published by the end of December of the calendar year in which the fiscal year reported upon ended.

222.title: Allowing quarterly payment of real and personal property taxes
222.description: Allowing quarterly payment of real and personal property taxes

223.title: Increasing the tax credits allowed for rehabilitation of certified historic structures
223.description: The purpose of this bill is to increase the tax credits allowed for rehabilitation of certified historic structures.

224.title: Exempting from personal income tax the entirety of any income received under the federal Social Security system for certain persons
224.description: Exempting from personal income tax the entirety of any income received under the federal Social Security system for certain persons

225.last_action: To House Agriculture and Natural Resources
225.title: Prohibiting the performing of an onychectomy or flexor tendonectomy procedure on a cat
225.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit the performing of a onychectomy (declawing) or flexor tendonectomy procedure on a cat or other animal.

226.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
226.title: Relating to the criminal offense of therapeutic deception
226.description: The purpose of this bill is to add medical doctors and doctors of osteopathy to the category of medical professionals who are subject to the prohibition against therapeutic deception.

227.last_action: To House Prevention and Treatment of Substance Abuse
227.title: Authorizing licensees authorized to sell growlers of nonintoxicating beer to offer complimentary samples
227.description: Authorizing licensees authorized to sell growlers of nonintoxicating beer to offer complimentary samples

228.title: Granting tax credits for parents and legal guardians whose children are in a home schooling program or private school
228.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide a two-tiered personal income tax credit to parents or legal guardians who provide home or private, primary or secondary education for their children.Â The tax credit will be effective upon the completion of a school year and available at a rate per child of $1,000 for home schooling and $2,000 for private schooling.Â The bill authorizes rule-making.

229.title: Barring persons who are convicted of certain criminal offenses from acquiring property from their victims
229.description: Barring persons who are convicted of certain criminal offenses from acquiring property from their victims

230.last_action: To House Small Business, Entrepreneurship and Economic Development
230.title: Authorizing operators of a distillery or mini-distillery to offer for purchase and consumption liquor on the premises
230.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow a distillery or mini-distillery to offer liquor for retail sale and consumption on or off the premises if a licensed Class A private club is operating on the premises.

231.title: Relating to reevaluation of land damaged as a result of natural disaster
231.description: Relating to reevaluation of land damaged as a result of natural disaster

232.title: Relating to the disqualification of an employee for unemployment benefits
232.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide for the disqualification of an employee for unemployment benefits for any week, or portion of a week in which he or she left or lost his or her job as a result of a strike.

233.title: Suspending the implementation of the school aid formula until the year 2021
233.description: The purpose of this bill is to suspend the implementation of the school aid formula for school district budgeting until the year 2021; requiring that all school systems be funded at the level established by the 2016-2017 budget during this period; and providing that the Legislature develop a new funding formula to be implemented for the budget year 2021-2022.

234.last_action: To House Veterans' Affairs and Homeland Security
234.title: Permitting honorably discharged veterans to hunt, trap or fish in this state without first obtaining a license
234.description: The purpose of this bill is to permit honorably discharged veterans to hunt, trap or fish in this state without first obtaining a license.

235.title: Establishing academic standards and assessment methods
235.description: The purpose of this bill is to establish academic standards and assessment methods.

236.title: Relating to the compensation of personnel employed at the West Virginia Schools for the Deaf and the Blind
236.description: The purpose of this bill is to clarify a minimum salary scale for personnel employed by the West Virginia Schools for the Deaf and Blind, and to authorize the state board to establish salary schedules for additional compensation for certain teachers.

238.title: Relating to disclaimers and exclusions of warranties in consumer transactions for goods
238.description: The purpose of this bill is to permit the sale of used manufactured homes with “as is” warranties or sale with waivers of warranties as to defects disclosed by the merchant.

239.title: Developing a special hiring procedure for personnel positions in the Division of Highways
239.description: The purpose of this bill is to require the Commissioner of the West Virginia Division of Highways and the Director of the West Virginia Division of Personnel to collaborate to develop a special hiring process for Division of Highways positions; to exempt the West Virginia Division of Highways from regular State Personnel Board Procedures upon implementation of the special hiring process; to establish requirements for the special hiring process; and to establish reporting requirements.

240.title: Changing the way counties pay for regional jail inmates
240.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide to counties an hourly cost when paying for the incarceration of inmates in regional jails instead of a daily rate.

241.last_action: To House Small Business, Entrepreneurship and Economic Development
241.title: Creating tax credits for new and/or existing small businesses
241.description: Creating tax credits for new and/or existing small businesses

242.title: Requiring the Division of Juvenile Services to transfer to a correctional facility or regional jail any juvenile in its custody that has been transferred to adult jurisdiction of the circuit court and who reaches his or her eighteenth birthday
242.description: Requiring the Division of Juvenile Services to transfer to a correctional facility or regional jail any juvenile in its custody that has been transferred to adult jurisdiction of the circuit court and who reaches his or her eighteenth birthday

243.title: Relating to the forfeiture of unencumbered funds in special revenue accounts
243.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide for the forfeiture of unencumbered funds in special revenue accounts and repayment of certain percentages of the special revenue accounts to the General Revenue Fund, if these accounts have been inactive for designated periods. The bill also prohibits expenditures from these accounts pending the forfeiture of the funds.

244.title: Requiring a transfer from reappropriated revenue accounts to General Revenue Fund
244.description: The purpose of this bill is to require the Treasurer to transfer fifty percent of the unencumbered balance of each reappropriated revenue account in the State Treasury to the General Fund, under certain circumstances.

245.last_action: To House Veterans' Affairs and Homeland Security
245.title: Granting a veteran with a hundred percent service-connected disability a $10,000 exemption from the assessed value for one vehicle
245.description: The purpose of this bill is to grant a veteran with a hundred percent service-connected disability a $10,000 exemption from the assessed value for one vehicle that is not used for commercial purposes.

246.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
246.title: Creating a rebuttable presumption that development of certain cancers by professional or volunteer firefighters arose out of the course of employment
246.description: color:windowtext'>The purpose of this bill is to provide a rebuttable presumption that a professional firefighter who developed leukemia, lymphoma or multiple myeloma arising out of and in the course of employment as a firefighter provided that the firefighter completed certain cancer screening, the firefighter worked in West Virginia as a firefighter for at least five years, the firefighter has not used tobacco products for ten years and is not over sixty-five years old.

247.last_action: To House Small Business, Entrepreneurship and Economic Development
247.title: Creating tax credits for small businesses
247.description: Creating tax credits for small businesses

248.title: Permitting certain surface owners to purchase gas at market rates
248.description: Permitting certain surface owners to purchase gas at market rates

249.title: Establishing an industrial water extraction fee
249.description: The purpose of this bill is establishing industrial water extraction fees. The bill places a penny fee on every gallon of water extracted for industrial use. The bill places an additional penny fee on every gallon of water extracted for industrial use that is transported over state roads.
