The bill requires measuring of water withdrawals by a specified method. The bill defines terms and provides rule-making authority.

250.title: Streamlining the process of abandoned mineral interests
250.description: Streamlining the process of abandoned mineral interests

251.title: Creating a special motor vehicle collector license plate
251.description: Creating a special motor vehicle collector license plate

252.title: West Virginia Monument and Memorial Protection Act of 2017
252.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit the relocation, removal, alteration, renaming, rededication, or other disturbance of any statue, monument, memorial, nameplate, or plaque which is located on public property and has been erected for, or named, or dedicated in honor of certain historical military, civil rights, and Native American events, figures, and organizations; to prohibit any person from preventing the governmental entity having responsibility for maintaining the items, structures, or areas from taking proper measures to protect, preserve, care for, repair, or restore the items, structures, or areas; and to establish a process by which the West Virginia State Historic Preservation Office may grant waivers under certain circumstances.

253.title: Requiring licensees authorized to serve alcoholic liquors or nonintoxicating beer to have certain liability insurance coverage
253.description: The purpose of this bill is to require licensees authorized to serve alcoholic liquors or nonintoxicating beer to have certain liability insurance coverage to cover the premises of the licensee. The bill establishes a statutory minimum level of insurance coverage. The bill directs the Alcoholic Beverage Control Commissioner, upon a finding that either statutory minimum insurance coverage is inadequate, to increase statutory minimum coverage amounts by legislative rule.

254.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
254.title: Advanced Practice Registered Nurse Compact
254.description: The purpose of this bill is to enact the Advanced Practice Registered Nurse Compact. Strike-throughs indicate language that would be stricken from a heading or the present law and underscoring indicates new language that would be added.

255.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
255.title: Eliminating the certificate of need program
255.description: The purpose of this bill is to terminate the certificate of need program for healthcare facilities and delete references to the certificate of need program throughout the code. §16-2D-1 has been completely rewritten; therefore, it has been completely underscored..

256.title: Improving the focus on school-level continuous improvement processes
256.description: The purpose of this bill is to improve the focus on school-level continuous improvement processes led by the principal. The bill includes instructional leadership among the duties and responsibilities of principals and assistants and requires instruction in their certification requirements. The instruction must include the standards for high quality schools, the school accreditation process and strategic planning for continuous improvement. School systems are given the flexibility to establish their own systems of support and supervision of beginning principals and the current state mandated programs and processes are eliminated. The systems for delivering professional development are realigned to focus on the needs identified by schools in their strategic planning processes led by the principal, including those identified through professional personnel evaluations, and the state-level professional development plan is eliminated. In addition, the current Center for Professional Development, Principal’s Academy, and Department and Secretary of Education and the Arts are eliminated along with related programs that are no longer operational, and the various remaining divisions in the Department of Education and the Arts are transferred to other Departments except for the Educational Broadcasting Authority which will become an independent agency within the Executive branch.

257.title: Requiring the amount of child support to be paid is effective from the date the petition for the modification was filed
257.description: The purpose of this bill is to require in the event the amount of child support to be paid is modified by a later child support order, the amount of child support to be paid is effective from the date the petition for the modification was filed, not the date the subsequent order was entered.

258.last_action: To House Veterans' Affairs and Homeland Security
258.title: Allowing military personnel and reservists the additional five-year period to enter upon or recover land already allowed to infants and the insane
258.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow military personnel and reservists the additional five-year period to enter upon or recover land already allowed to infants and the insane.

259.title: Authorizing local units of government to adopt local energy efficiency partnership programs
259.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize local units of government to adopt local energy efficiency partnership programs and to create districts to promote the use of energy efficiency improvements by owners of certain real property; to provide for the financing of such programs through voluntary property assessments, commercial lending, and other means; to authorize a local unit of government to issue bonds, notes, and other evidences of indebtedness and to pay the cost of energy efficiency improvements from the proceeds thereof; to provide for the repayment of bonds, notes, and other evidences of indebtedness; to authorize certain fees; to prescribe the powers and duties of certain governmental officers and entities; and to provide remedies.

260.title: Relating to disability pensions of municipal employees
260.description: Relating to disability pensions of municipal employees

261.title: Permitting a housing authority to garnish delinquent rents and other amounts owed to the authority from the renter’s income tax refund
261.description: Permitting a housing authority to garnish delinquent rents and other amounts owed to the authority from the renter’s income tax refund

262.title: Preventing the State Board of Education from implementing common core academic standards and assessments
262.description: Preventing the State Board of Education from implementing common core academic standards and assessments

263.title: Allowing replacement costs of employer provided property to be deducted from an employee’s final paycheck if the property is not returned
263.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow uniform costs to be deducted from an employee’s final paycheck if the uniform is not returned.

265.last_action: To House Agriculture and Natural Resources
265.title: Relating to an exemption from the consumers sales and service tax and use tax for sales of services and tangible personal property related to the activities of raising and training livestock
265.description: Relating to an exemption from the consumers sales and service tax and use tax for sales of services and tangible personal property related to the activities of raising and training livestock

267.title: Requiring the Joint Committee on Government and Finance to prepare a “Coercive Federal Funds Report” on each budget bill
267.description: The purpose of this bill is to require the Joint Committee on Government and Finance to prepare a “Coercive Federal Funds Report” on each budget bill; to empower the Attorney General to bring suit in federal courts to enjoin the application of federal laws containing coercive federal funds; and to affirm that the policy of the State of West Virginia is that coercive federal funds are unconstitutional and violate the principles of federalism.

268.title: Relating to tuition and fees at community and technical colleges
268.description: Relating to tuition and fees at community and technical colleges

269.last_action: To House Small Business, Entrepreneurship and Economic Development
269.title: Relating to complimentary samples of nonintoxicating beer or nonintoxicating craft beer
269.description: The purpose of this bill is to permit licensed brewpubs, Class A retail dealers, Class B retail dealers, private clubs, Class A retail licensees and Class B retail licensees to serve complimentary samples of nonintoxicating beer or nonintoxicating craft beer manufactured in the State of West Virginia and to remove prior restrictions on Class A retail licensees’ ability to serve complimentary nonintoxicating beer samples to customers.

270.title: West Virginia Fresh Food Act
270.description: The purpose of this bill is to require all state-funded institutions to purchase a minimum of twenty percent of fresh produce from in-state producers.

271.title: Relating to failure to maintain state and public roads
271.description: The purpose of this bill is to require that state and public roads that have not been maintained for a period of three consecutive years shall be returned to their original tract of land.

272.title: Making the Holy Bible the official state book of West Virginia
272.description: The purpose of this bill is to make the Holy Bible the official state book of West Virginia.

273.title: Developing a resource for use by parents to monitor and track deaf and hard-of-hearing children’s expressive and receptive language acquisition
273.description: The purpose of this bill is to require the State Department of Education and the Schools for the Deaf and the Blind to jointly select language developmental milestones from existing standardized norms for purposes of developing a resource for use by parents to monitor and track deaf and hard-of-hearing children’s expressive and receptive language acquisition and developmental stages toward English literacy.

274.title: Providing for the authorization and oversight of public charter schools
274.description: The purpose of this bill is to increase high-quality educational opportunities within the public school system by allowing authorized public schools and programs exceptional levels of self-direction and flexibility in exchange for exceptional levels of results-driven accountability.Â To accomplish this, the bill provides an infrastructure for the authorization and oversight of new start-up schools, conversions of existing schools or conversions of programs within existing schools that are accountable for student learning, operations and governance under a performance contract or charter subject to a five-year renewal, but then are exempt from the regulatory framework applicable to public schools without a charter contract.Â However, the bill includes a detailed and comprehensive definition of public charter schools that lists what these schools may and may not do, what rules and statutes they must abide by and how they are to be governed.Â The bill creates a statewide Public Charter School Oversight and Authorizer Board to develop policy, provide training, and perform oversight, administrative and reporting functions, including reporting directly to the state board.Â The bill requires the organizers of these charter schools must apply to the county board who may choose to be the authorizer of the school or forward the application to the statewide board for consideration and authorization.

275.title: Relating to disqualification for unemployment benefits
275.description: Relating to disqualification for unemployment benefits

276.title: Relating to damages for medical monitoring
276.description: Relating to damages for medical monitoring

277.title: Relating to admissibility of certain evidence in a civil action for damages
277.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow admission of evidence in a civil action of the use or nonuse of a safety belt on the issues of negligence, contributory negligence, comparative negligence and failure to mitigate damages.

278.title: Relating to limitations on the use of wages and agency shop fees by employers and labor organization for political activities
278.description: The purpose of this bill is to protect an employee’s wages or salaries from being withheld or diverted for political activities without the express, written authorization of the employee.Â The bill makes clear that it is unlawful for any person to coerce or intimidate any employee into making a political contribution or engaging in political activities.Â The bill also makes it an unfair labor practice for any labor organization to use agency shop fees paid for by nonmembers for contributions or expenditures to influence an election without the authorization of the individual.

279.title: Small Business Tax Credit
279.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide a temporary tax credit for small group employers to cover a tax credit of up to fifty percent of the costs of branding, marketing and advertising of agricultural or manufactured products produced or manufactured in West Virginia. The bill establishes limits. The bill provides that the credit be available for five years. These sections have been completely rewritten; therefore, they have been completely underscored.

280.title: Annual retirement annuity adjustment West Virginia State Police Retirement System
280.description: The purpose of this bill is to increase the annual cost of living benefits for retirants in the West Virginia State Police Retirement System from one percent a year to three percent a year.

281.title: Relating to the placement of juvenile status offenders
281.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide that a status offender may not be placed in a Division of Juvenile Services facility, unless the status offending child has run away from placement in a staff secure facility.Â The bill provides that in that event the court may order the juvenile placed in a Division of Juvenile Services facility pending further proceeding in the matter.

283.title: Relating to safety of tow trucks, wreckers, and tilt-bed vehicles
283.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide that tow trucks, wreckers and tilt-bed vehicles may use red flashing warning lights while loading, unloading or assisting disabled vehicles.

284.title: Relating to the Municipal Police and Fire Retirement System
284.description: The introduction of this bill was requested by the Consolidated Public Retirement System.Â The purpose of this bill is to add a definition for “vested” to Municipal Police and Fire Retirement System; and clarify duty/non-duty disability.

285.title: Relating to employee information reported to the Consolidated Public Retirement Board
285.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide minimum reporting requirements for employee information to the Consolidated Public Retirement Board.

286.title: Extending the maximum period of confinement a judge may impose for certain, first-time probationary violations
286.description: The purpose of this bill is to extend the maximum period of confinement a judge may impose for certain, first-time probationary violations from sixty days to six months. The bill also provides judges greater sentencing discretion for certain, subsequent violations of probation.

287.title: Requiring the Commissioner of Highways to contract with private providers or contractors for certain emergency maintenance operations
287.description: The purpose of this bill is to require the Commissioner of Highways to contract with private providers or contractors for emergency maintenance operations if the Division of Highways cannot complete operations in a timely manner; to create a provisional appointment procedure for Division of Highway positions necessary for snow and ice removal from roadways; to authorize the Division of Highways to solicit applications and appoint qualified applicants to provisional snow and ice removal positions pending permanent appointment; to exempt provisionary appointments for snow and ice removal services from State Personnel Board Procedures and oversight; to create a process by which individual provisionary snow and ice removal appointees shall be converted to permanent employees within the classified service system once certain requirements are met; and to require the Division of Highways to follow ethical guidelines and certain practices when posting provisional appointments and making provisional appointments to snow and ice removal positions.

288.last_action: To House Small Business, Entrepreneurship and Economic Development
288.title: Allowing a person to be both a limited video lottery operator and retailer
288.description: Allowing a person to be both a limited video lottery operator and retailer

289.title: Repealing section relating to unattended motor vehicles and penalties
289.description: The purpose of this bill is to repeal §17C-14-1 relating to unattended motor vehicles; penalty.

290.title: Allowing state, county or municipal employees with a license to carry a concealed weapon to possess a firearm at any time in this state
290.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow state, county or municipal employees with a license to carry a concealed weapon to possess a firearm at any time in this state.

291.last_action: To House Prevention and Treatment of Substance Abuse
291.title: Prohibiting health care practitioners from knowingly and in bad faith prescribing or administering drugs
291.description: Prohibiting health care practitioners from knowingly and in bad faith prescribing or administering drugs

292.title: Providing a tax credit for obtaining certain certifications by the United States Green Building Council Leadership in Energy and Environmental Design green building rating system
292.description: Providing a tax credit for obtaining certain certifications by the United States Green Building Council Leadership in Energy and Environmental Design green building rating system

293.title: Decreasing the personal income tax rates for certain taxpayers and raising the personal income tax rates for certain other taxpayers
293.description: The purpose of this bill is to decrease the personal income tax rate for certain taxpayers and raising personal income tax rate for certain other taxpayers.

294.title: Prohibiting discrimination based upon age or sexual orientation
294.description: Prohibiting discrimination based upon age or sexual orientation

295.title: Returning Veterans and Displaced Miners Jobs Act
295.description: The purpose of this bill is to assist returning veterans and displaced coal miners to find meaningful employment through quality skills training using the apprenticeship model.Â The bill creates the “Returning Veterans and Displaced Miners Jobs Act “and provides a short title, legislative findings and declaration.Â It establishes a Veterans Job Coordinating Team and provides for the composition of the team, together with its powers and duties.Â The team is required to report a plan to the Legislature by December 1, 2017, outlining suggested plans, methods and procedures designed to implement the purposes for which the team was established.Â Finally; the bill provides for termination of the Veterans Job Coordinating Team unless the Legislature determines otherwise.

297.last_action: To House Agriculture and Natural Resources
297.title: Requiring that open hunting season for big game begin on a Saturday
297.description: The purpose of this bill is to require that open hunting season for big game begin on a Saturday; remove certain restrictions on hunting; permit Sunday hunting on private property throughout the state with written consent of the landowner; create a ballot measure permitting counties to prohibit Sunday hunting on private land if a majority of voters within the county approve the prohibition; and permit Sunday hunting on certain public lands in counties where private hunting on Sunday is permitted.

298.last_action: To House Agriculture and Natural Resources
298.title: Allowing children in the custody of the state in any foster home, group home or other facility or residence to hunt and fish without a license
298.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow children in the custody of the state in any foster home, group home or other facility or residence to hunt and fish without a license.

299.title: Requiring state institutions of higher education to conduct Phase 3 clinical research studies for any cancer treatment
299.description: Requiring state institutions of higher education to conduct Phase 3 clinical research studies for any cancer treatment

300.title: Relating to nonpartisan election of justices of the Supreme Court of Appeals
300.description: Relating to nonpartisan election of justices of the Supreme Court of Appeals

301.title: Relating to county commissions authorizing reasonable fees charged for fire department or fire company response
301.description: Relating to county commissions authorizing reasonable fees charged for fire department or fire company response

303.title: Preventing compensatory damage awards for medical expenses from including sums that the claimant has not and will not pay
303.description: Preventing compensatory damage awards for medical expenses from including sums that the claimant has not and will not pay

304.last_action: To House Prevention and Treatment of Substance Abuse
304.title: Increasing penalties for manufacturing or transportation of a controlled substance in the presence of a minor
304.description: The purpose of this bill is to increase the minimum sentence by three years for individuals convicted of manufacturing, delivering, or transporting controlled substances in the presence of a minor.

305.title: Adding violations of law upon which a public servant’s retirement plan may be forfeited
305.description: The purpose of this bill is to add additional violations of law, and removes exceptions for certain lesser included crimes, that could cause the forfeiture of a participant’s retirement plan.

306.title: Expanding county commissions’ ability to dispose of county or district property
306.description: Expanding county commissions’ ability to dispose of county or district property

307.title: Defining and establishing the crime of cyberbullying
307.description: Defining and establishing the crime of cyberbullying

309.title: Permitting recreational gold mining
309.description: The purpose of this bill is to permit recreational gold mining.

310.title: Prohibiting the waste of game animals, game birds or game fish
310.description: Prohibiting the waste of game animals, game birds or game fish

311.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
311.title: Requiring a person restraining a mentally ill or mentally challenged person in a "four point restraint" to administer sedation by injection at the time the patient is secured
311.description: Requiring a person restraining a mentally ill or mentally challenged person in a "four point restraint" to administer sedation by injection at the time the patient is secured

312.title: Providing for security of private, employer-sponsored insurance and/or retirement plans
312.description: The purpose of this bill is to require security in the form of bond, cash or other collateral to protect private, employer-sponsored insurance and pension plans.

314.title: Relating to state ownership of wildlife
314.description: The purpose of this bill is to make the definition of wildlife consistent with the existing definition of wildlife contained in WV Code §20-1-2.

315.title: Relating to the development and implementation of a program to facilitate commercial sponsorship of rest areas
315.description: The purpose of this bill is to develop and implement a program to facilitate commercial sponsorship of rest areas, welcome centers, and roads. The bill provides for sponsorship agreements. The bill provides for agreement requirements. The bill provides for disposition of funds received from agreements. The bill provides for the promulgation of emergency or legislative rules. The bill provides for a report of the status of the program.

316.title: Creating a pilot program for expansion of school-based mental health and school-based diversion
316.description: Creating a pilot program for expansion of school-based mental health and school-based diversion

317.title: Relating to crossbow hunting
317.description: The purpose of this bill is to clarify that the use of a crossbow for hunting big game requires additional licenses, stamps or permits (with exception of buck firearms season) with a Class A hunting and trapping license. The bill permits crossbow hunting with Class RB, Class RRB, and Class UU licenses and with a Class BG stamp.

318.title: Establishing regional recreation authorities and areas
318.description: color:windowtext'>The purpose of this bill is to create a new system for three or more contiguous counties to create a regional recreation authority for off- highway vehicle trail riding and for other recreational purposes.

319.title: Providing certain notice to civil service exempt employees dismissed from employment due to change in administration
319.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide to any at-will, civil service exempt employee, dismissed from a job due to a change in administration, a minimum notice and time to vacate his or her office.

320.last_action: To House Agriculture and Natural Resources
320.title: Making information about Division of Natural Resources licensees exempt from the provisions of the Freedom of Information Act
320.description: The purpose of this bill is to exempt the list of the names, addresses and contact information for DNR license holders from public disclosure with certain exceptions.

321.title: Providing that the court allocate time equally between parents
321.description: The purpose of this bill is to require the court to allocate time equally between parents, unless equal custody is not consistent with the best interest of the child.

322.title: Relating to a lawful method for a developmentally disabled person to purchase a base hunting license
322.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow persons with developmental disabilities to receive a base hunting license and to satisfy the training requirements through a modified training course. This bill also authorizes person with developmental disabilities to lawfully hunt while accompanied and directly supervised by another hunter, and provides criminal penalties for violation of this subsection.

323.title: Including unborn child or fetus in statute setting criminal penalties for child neglect resulting in death
323.description: Including unborn child or fetus in statute setting criminal penalties for child neglect resulting in death

324.title: Permitting persons who have been issued state licenses to carry concealed deadly weapons to carry those weapons on the grounds of the State Capitol Complex
324.description: The purpose of this bill is to permit persons who have been issued state licenses to carry concealed deadly weapons to carry those weapons on the grounds of the State Capitol Complex, except for the third and fourth floors of the east wing of Building One.

325.title: Permitting the carrying of concealed weapons on the campus of a state institution of higher education
325.description: Permitting the carrying of concealed weapons on the campus of a state institution of higher education

326.title: Permitting a firearm or other deadly weapon on or in a private primary or secondary education building, structure or facility
326.description: The purpose of this bill is to permit persons who have been issued state licenses to carry concealed deadly weapons pursuant to Code, 61-7-4 to possesses a firearm or other deadly weapon on or in a private primary or secondary education building, structure or facility.

327.title: Establishing procedures for carrying out the death sentence
327.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide for a death penalty and procedures and standards applicable thereto, and automatic review of the penalty, for commission of murder in the first degree.Â Procedures for carrying out the death sentence are established.

328.title: Imposing an indefinite moratorium on new business and occupancy or privilege taxes
328.description: Imposing an indefinite moratorium on new business and occupancy or privilege taxes

329.title: Relating to primary elections for nonpartisan offices including Justices of the Supreme Court, circuit court judges, family court judges, and magistrates
329.description: The purpose of this bill is to relate to elections generally; primary elections for nonpartisan offices including Justices of the Supreme Court, circuit court judges, family court judges and magistrates; legislative findings; primary date; political parties presidential preference vote may be changed; election at primary under stated circumstances; municipal elections moved to general election dates and limitation of article.

330.title: Providing an identification card for released inmates who do not have a West Virginia identification card or driver’s license
330.description: The purpose of this bill is to facilitate a released inmate’s reintegration into society, by requiring the Commissioner of the Division of Motor Vehicles and Commissioner of Corrections, to provide an identification card for inmates who do not have a West Virginia identification card or driver’s license.

332.title: Requiring the release of an unemancipated minor's medical records for drug testing
332.description: Requiring the release of an unemancipated minor's medical records for drug testing

333.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
333.title: Adding the examination of Advanced Care Technician
333.description: Adding the examination of Advanced Care Technician

334.title: Legalizing sport pool betting
334.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow sports betting at West Virginia casinos; the state Lottery Commission is authorized to promulgate legislatives rule establishing sports betting and provides a legislative finding that federal government has no authority to prohibit sports betting in West Virginia; providing for a tax on bets and a special revenue account; and allowing incorporation of current laws and the promulgation of further requirements and fees for sports betting by legislative rule.

335.title: Relating to fire fees on nonresidents of a municipality
335.description: The purpose of this bill is to cap the fire fees on nonresidents of a municipality who are users of that municipality’s fire service. The bill excludes charges for certain buildings.

336.title: Requiring a seller of real property satisfy upon closing any unpaid charges owed
336.description: Requiring a seller of real property satisfy upon closing any unpaid charges owed

337.title: Making Promise scholarships available for students pursuing certificates or degrees through an accredited community and technical college
337.description: The purpose of this bill is to make Promise scholarships available to students who wish to pursue a vocational certificate or degree in a community and technical college education program.

338.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
338.title: Relating to Medical Professional Liability

339.title: Relating to qualifications of paraprofessionals, autism mentors and braille or sign support specialists
339.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide that paraprofessional, autism mentor and braille or sign support specialist qualify for early childhood classroom assistant teacher positions.

340.title: Modifying the penalties imposed on debt collectors who violate the provisions of the West Virginia Consumer Credit and Protection Act
340.description: Modifying the penalties imposed on debt collectors who violate the provisions of the West Virginia Consumer Credit and Protection Act

341.title: Relating to the preservation of rights guaranteed by the West Virginia Constitution and the United States Constitution when deciding the comity of a legal decision in a foreign country
341.description: The purpose of this bill is to preserve the rights of individuals guaranteed by the West Virginia Constitution and the United States Constitution when deciding the comity of a legal decision in a foreign country, the choice of law used for contractual interpretations and choice of forum. The bill exempts businesses. The bill also makes legislative findings, states public policy, defines a term and provides a severability provision.

342.title: Requiring welders working in the State of West Virginia to meet certain certification requirements
342.description: The purpose of this bill is to require welders working in the State of West Virginia to meet certain certification requirements and to conform to national welding standards.

343.title: Requiring all unclaimed oil and gas royalties due a leaseholder of the mineral estate shall be transferred and paid to the legal surface owner
343.description: Requiring all unclaimed oil and gas royalties due a leaseholder of the mineral estate shall be transferred and paid to the legal surface owner

344.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
344.title: Relating to licensure of behavioral health centers and behavioral health consumer rights
344.description: The purpose of this bill is to reauthorize, with amendment, as one rule, the legislative rules contained in title sixty-four, series eleven and series seventy-four of the code of state rules relating to licensure of behavioral health centers (64 CSR 11) and behavioral health consumer rights, (64 CSR 74).

345.title: Clarifying existing language for those first responders who die as a direct result of their duties
345.description: The purpose of this bill is to clarify existing language for those first responders who die as a direct result of their duties as a firefighter, EMS or law-enforcement provider.

346.title: Authorizing the Public Service Commission to regulate the billing practices of utilities and other entities that utilize wired or wireless transmission
346.description: Authorizing the Public Service Commission to regulate the billing practices of utilities and other entities that utilize wired or wireless transmission

347.title: Creating an additional class of special education classroom aides
347.description: The purpose of this bill is to create an additional class of special education classroom aide and to specify the pay grade for this class of school service personnel.

348.last_action: To House Agriculture and Natural Resources
348.title: Transferring the Division of Forestry from the Department of Commerce to the Department of Agriculture
348.description: The purpose of this bill is to transfer the Division of Forestry and its authorities, powers and duties from the Department of Commerce to the Department of Agriculture.

349.title: Clarifying a director of a multicounty vocational technical school is a principal
349.description: The purpose of this bill is to clarify that directors of multicounty schools are principals and not superintendents.

350.title: Prohibiting the superintendent of schools from requiring a physical examination to be included to the application for a minor’s work permit
350.description: This purpose of this bill is to prohibit the superintendent of schools from requiring a physical examination to be included to the application for a minor’s work permit unless it is required by the prospective employer.

351.title: Permitting inspectors working within the Division of Dealer Services of the Division of Motor Vehicles to carry a concealed weapon on duty
351.description: The purpose of this bill is to permit inspectors working within the Division of Dealer Services of the Division of Motor Vehicles to carry a concealed weapon on duty.

352.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
352.title: The West Virginia Assisted Outpatient Treatment Act
352.description: baseline'>The purpose of this bill is to provide assisted outpatient treatment to individuals suffering from mental illness to prevent such individuals from decompensating to the point of likelihood to cause serious harm to self or others for safety of the public, to prevent the costs of inpatient involuntary hospitalization, and costs of incarceration due to untreated mental illness.Â The bill defines terms, requires legal proceedings, and provides for limitation of liability to examiners and providers.

353.title: Relating to basic state aid to public education
353.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide an adjustment to the allocated state aid share to any county on account of, and in the amount of, payments or contributions in lieu of property tax distributed from the sheriff to the county board of education as a result of payment in lieu of tax agreements first entered into on or after July 1, 2016.

354.title: Creating a litigation practice license for social workers
354.description: The purpose of this bill is to create a litigation practice license for social workers.

356.title: Providing for the reduction of the unfunded liability in the teachers retirement system over a 30 year period
356.description: Providing for the reduction of the unfunded liability in the teachers retirement system over a 30 year period

357.title: Prohibiting West Virginia institutions of higher learning and state agencies from discriminating against graduates of private, nonpublic or home schools by requiring them to submit to alternative testing
357.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit state agencies and institutions of higher learning from discriminating against graduates of private, nonpublic or home schools by requiring them to submit to alternative testing as a precondition for acceptance into the institution of higher learning.

358.last_action: To House Agriculture and Natural Resources
358.title: West Virginia Farm-to-Food Bank Tax Credit
358.description: West Virginia Farm-to-Food Bank Tax Credit

359.title: Allowing honorably discharged veterans who possess certain military ratings to qualify to take an examination for licensing as a plumber, electrician, and sprinkler fitter
359.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow honorably discharged veterans who possess certain military ratings to qualify to take an examination for licensing as a plumber, electrician, and sprinkler fitter.

360.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
360.title: Establishing a statewide call-in center to receive assistance with healthcare
360.description: The purpose of this bill is to establish a statewide call-in center for all state residents to utilize as an access point to get advice for medical conditions. The call-in center will allow an initial review of a health condition and may if authorized by the Commissioner of the Bureau of Public Health, allow reference by the nurse for assistance from a physician.Â The commissioner will establish protocols and contract with a vendor to administer the on-call center.

361.title: Exempting State Teachers Retirement System pension benefits from West Virginia personal income taxation
361.description: The purpose of this bill is to exempt State Teachers Retirement System pension benefits from West Virginia personal income tax.

362.title: Requiring state institutions of higher education adopt policies concerning sexual assault, domestic violence, dating violence and stalking
362.description: Requiring state institutions of higher education adopt policies concerning sexual assault, domestic violence, dating violence and stalking

363.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
363.title: Eliminating provisions and repealing statutes related to the West Virginia Health Information Network
363.description: The purpose of this bill is to eliminate provisions and repeal statutes related to the West Virginia Health Information Network and health information exchanges.

364.title: Establishing a toll-free phone line for receipt of comments from the public about state programs and services
364.description: The purpose of this bill is to establish a toll-free phone line for receipt of comments from the public about state programs and services which will be reported online for all to see and review.

365.title: Relating to the reconstitution of the Driver’s Licensing Advisory Board
365.description: The purpose of this bill is to reconstitute the Driver’s Licensing Advisory Board, to require one member of the board to be a licensed neurologist in this state, to require the board to respond to requests of the commissioner when necessary in the discretion of the commissioner, to delete obsolete language.

366.title: Allowing the owner of an antique military vehicle to display alternate registration insignia
366.description: Allowing the owner of an antique military vehicle to display alternate registration insignia

367.title: Relating to the collection of municipal sales tax by vendors of goods and services
367.description: The purpose of this bill is to exempt vendors delivering goods by common carrier from requirements to collect municipal sales tax and to provide that vendors delivering goods or services directly to a purchaser may only be required to collect tax if the vendor knows or has reason to know that the point of delivery is located within a taxing municipality’s boundaries.

368.title: Allowing military veterans who meet certain qualifications to qualify for examination for license as an emergency medical technician
368.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow military veterans who meet certain qualifications to qualify for examination for license as an emergency medical technician

369.title: Requiring board members to have attended a board meeting to be compensated for the meeting
369.description: Requiring board members to have attended a board meeting in order to be compensated for the meeting

370.title: Authorizing a temporary foreign brewers import license
370.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize temporary thirty day licenses for out-of-state nonintoxicating beer brewers to import beer for test marketing and distribute to festivals and samplings.

371.title: Permitting Class III municipalities to be included in the West Virginia Tax Increment Act
371.description: Permitting Class III and Class IV municipalities to be included in the West Virginia Tax Increment Act

372.title: Establishing that the Division of Corrections is responsible for the costs of housing and maintaining an inmate the day following an inmate’s conviction
372.description: The purpose of this bill is to establish that the Division of Corrections is responsible for inmate’s housing costs beginning the day after the inmate’s conviction.

373.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
373.title: Relating to the state’s Medicaid Home and Community-Based Services Intellectual/Developmental Disability Waiver
373.description: Relating to the state’s Medicaid Home and Community-Based Services Intellectual/Developmental Disability Waiver

374.title: Livable Home Tax Credit
374.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide a tax credit for modifications to homes made more accessible for an elderly person or a person with a disability.

375.title: Providing that the compensation level of the Chancellor for Higher Education may be no more than the salary of the Governor
375.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide that the compensation level of the Chancellor for Higher Education may be no greater than the salary of the Governor.

376.title: Relating to more equitable disbursement of funds to county boards
376.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide a more equitable disbursement of funds to county boards of education to lessen budgetary impact of serving high cost/high acuity special needs students. It also eliminates the requirements for an annual review of rules, policies and standards and federal law and a report to the Legislative Oversight Commission on Educational Accountability.

377.title: Relating to care, custody and visitation of pets involved in separation and divorce proceedings
377.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize courts to determine custody and visitation for pets in divorce proceedings and to allow for the inclusion of pet care, custody and visitation in property settlements and separation agreements.

378.title: Creating a loan tuition forgiveness program to encourage students in selected and necessary fields to remain in the state
378.description: The purpose of this bill is to create a loan tuition forgiveness program to encourage students in selected and necessary fields to remain in the state; create a “New College Families” loan forgiveness program; and create a loan forgiveness program for counties with low college attendance.

379.title: Authorizing a medical power of attorney representative to sign a binding arbitration agreement
379.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize a medical power of attorney representative to sign a binding arbitration agreement with an extended care facility operated in conjunction with a hospital, an assisted living facility, or a nursing home and their related entities and employees.Â

380.title: Establishing the “Stay in State” tax credit
380.description: The purpose of this bill is to establish the “Stay in the state Act” tax credit that allows residents of this state who remain in state after graduating with an undergraduate orÂ associate degree from a state institution to be granted a tax credit for the total cost of tuition and interest for student loans used to obtain their degree; this tax credit is against personal property tax in West Virginia and is awarded over a ten-year period; employers are also allowed to claim the credit for employees that qualify for the credit; and in-state high schools, colleges and universities are required to inform and assist students with obtaining the tax credit.

381.title: Prohibiting use of a person's credit history in certain insurance transactions
381.description: The purpose of this bill is to Â prohibit the use of a person’s credit history in certain insurance transactions.

382.title: Relating to erroneous tax assessments and overpayments to the county
382.description: The purpose of this bill is to create a method by which aggrieved taxpayers, who believe that they were erroneously assessed or overpaid taxes based on an overestimation or unintentional mistake, may seek additional review by the State Auditor in order to reverse an adverse decision by a county commission. The bill clarifies that relief may be sought for overpayment of taxes by a taxpayer.Â The bill establishes a process to petition the Auditor for additional review of a county commission’s decision. The bill grants the Auditor express authority to order the county commission to make reimbursement or issue a tax credit where a county commission’s decision is found to be clearly erroneous.Â Finally, this bill grants the Auditor express authority to promulgate emergency rules in order to comply with this section.

383.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
383.title: Relating to social determinants of health
383.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize model Community Health Equity Initiative Demonstration Projects which use existing state and local resources to promote community health and well being. The bill authorizes the Commissioner of the Bureau for Public Health to establish projects with eligibility requirements; and provides for the administration of projects. Additionally, the bill establishes the Minority Health Advisory Team including its composition and duties.

384.title: Increasing penalties for failure to use due caution when approaching an emergency vehicle
384.description: The purpose of this bill is to enhance penalties for failure to use due caution when approaching an emergency vehicle using emergency signals; and authorizing tow trucks and wreckers to use red emergency lights when responding to an accident, and use another vehicle to assist in a safe recovery of a vehicle.

385.title: Relating generally to Uniform Unclaimed Property Act
385.description: The purpose of this bill is to clarify that presumed abandoned property in the form of amounts owed by an insurer on a life or endowment insurance policy or an annuity that has matured or terminated, and obligations related thereto, are guided by policies, requirements and interpretations of the Insurance Commissioner.

386.title: Providing for paid leave for certain state officers and employees during a declared state of emergency
386.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide that certain state employees may be granted a leave of absence with pay while providing assistance as an essential member of an emergency aid provider during a declared state of emergency.

387.title: Eliminating the mandated employer versus employee cost share of eighty percent employer, twenty percent employee for Public Employee Insurance Agency
387.description: Eliminating the mandated employer versus employee cost share of eighty percent employer, twenty percent employee for Public Employee Insurance Agency

388.title: Relating to changes in distribution of net terminal income, excess net terminal income and excess lottery fund
388.description: Relating to changes in distribution of net terminal income, excess net terminal income and excess lottery fund

389.title: Relating to alternate sentencing for nonviolent felony offenders
389.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow certain alternate sentencing for nonviolent felony offenders.

390.last_action: To House Agriculture and Natural Resources
390.title: Relating to the definition of Managed Timberland
390.description: The purpose of this bill is to exclude from the definition of managed timberland any tract or parcel of real estate that is being leased by the owner to another party for monetary gain. The subsections have been placed in alphabetical order.

391.title: Requiring funding by the West Virginia Library Commission to local libraries be based on the population served by each respective library
391.description: Requiring funding by the West Virginia Library Commission to local libraries be based on the population served by each respective library

392.title: Relating to designation of social workers in the Department of Health and Human Services
392.description: The purpose of this bill is to have social workers identified for each elementary, middle school, junior high school and high school in the state who are to be available to teachers, principals, and other school staff upon request, to help improve or maintain school attendance and performance and to improve the health and well-being of students at home. Limitations on services are set forth.Â

393.title: Relating to retirement and separation incentives
393.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize Boards of Governors of institutions of higher education to develop retirement and incentive packages.

394.title: Removing the restriction on liquor licensees from having speakers outside or playing music outdoors
394.description: The purpose of this bill is to remove the restriction on liquor licenses from having speakers outside or playing music outdoors.

395.title: Allowing military veterans with certain military ratings to qualify for examinations required of probationary police officer
395.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow military veterans with certain military ratings to take examinations required for successful completion of a police officer’s probation period.Â

396.title: Establishing a Library Facilities Improvement Fund that will serve to support library facilities construction, maintenance and improvement projects
396.description: Establishing a Library Facilities Improvement Fund that will serve to support library facilities construction, maintenance and improvement projects

397.title: Including electronic communications to and from inmates with the types of communications that the Division of Corrections currently monitors and may record
397.description: Including electronic communications to and from inmates with the types of communications that the Division of Corrections currently monitors and may record

398.title: Removing requirement that persons who pass the bar in West Virginia be members of the West Virginia State Bar in order to practice
398.description: The purpose of this bill is to remove requirement that persons who pass the bar in West Virginia be members of the West Virginia State Bar in order to practice law in this state.

399.title: Relating to the collection of taxes on wine and intoxicating liquors
399.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide that no wine or liquor excise tax will be collected on purchases of wine or intoxicating liquors in the original sealed package for the purpose of resale, if the final purchase of the wine or intoxicating liquor is subject to the excise tax.Â The bill also provides that no liter tax will be collected on wine sold in the original sealed package for the purpose of resale, if the subsequent sale of the wine is subject to the liter tax.Â The bill also defines terms.

400.title: Restoring employees’ rights associated with agreeing to be represented by a labor organization
400.description: Restoring employees’ rights associated with agreeing to be represented by a labor organization

401.title: Requiring a warning light to be erected on certain roads to warn of a traffic light ahead
401.description: The purpose of this bill is to require that a warning lightÂ be erected on certain roads to warn of a traffic light ahead.

402.last_action: To House Veterans' Affairs and Homeland Security
402.title: Giving all honorably discharged veterans ten extra points when successfully completing a civil service examination
402.description: The purpose of this bill is to give all honorably discharged veterans ten extra points when successfully completing a civil service examination.

403.title: Requiring county school boards to provide adequate mental health and counseling services
403.description: The purpose of this bill is to require county school boards to provide adequate mental health and counseling services in the form of the employment of a psychologist or psychiatrist to pupils to address issues stemming from drug abuse.

404.title: Limiting the maximum number of appointees to certain county and municipal bodies
404.description: The purpose of this bill is to impose limits on the number of appointees to certain county and municipal bodies; and impose quorum requirements on certain county and municipal bodies.

405.title: Relating to real property option to purchase contracts executed with lease agreements
405.description: The purpose of this bill is to establish consumer protections for rent-to-own land contract.

406.title: Abolishing the office environmental advocate within the Department of Environmental Protection
406.description: The purpose of this bill is to is to abolish the office of environmental advocate effective July 1, 2017. Unused funds are to be deposited into the State General Fund.

407.title: Relating to powers and duties of the Commissioner of Public Health
407.description: The purpose of this bill is to modify administration of local boards of health; provide for regionalization of administration and services of local health departments; require local health departments to bill health insurance plans for services that are provided; mandate development of needle exchange programs in local health departments; and provide for rule-making authority.

408.title: Relating to registration requirements of the sex offender registration act
408.description: The purpose of this bill is to add persons who have been adjudicated as a juvenile delinquent for conduct related to qualifying offenses to comply with the registration requirements of the Sex Offender Registration Act.

409.title: Authorizing certain first responders to carry firearms
409.description: Authorizing certain first responders to carry firearms

410.title: Creating a felony penalty of life without mercy for the first degree murder of a law-enforcement officer
410.description: Creating a felony penalty of life without mercy for the first degree murder of a law-enforcement officer

411.title: Establishing a website clearinghouse for sharing information about potential sources of revenue, financial, technical and legal assistance for government agencies
411.description: The purpose of this bill is to establish an intergovernmental clearinghouse to share information among agencies of state and local government regarding potential sources of revenue and technical and legal assistance for government agencies.

412.title: Reducing the cost of the fee for a state license to carry a concealed weapon
412.description: The purpose of this bill is to reduce the cost of the fee for a state license to carry a concealed weapon.

413.title: Requiring the Commissioner of Highways to verify legal employment status of contractors and vendor’s employees for certain road and bridge contracts
413.description: The purpose of this bill is to require that Department of Highways contracts in excess of $500,000 be entered into with contractors who verify that its employees and those employees of any subcontractors only utilize workers lawfully working in the United States.

414.title: Relating to installation of conduit for fiber optic cable on state highway construction projects
414.description: The purpose of this bill is to require the installation of conduit for fiber optic cable on state highway construction projects.

415.title: Relating to the comprehensive statewide student assessment
415.description: The purpose of this bill is to to require ACT and ACT Aspire to be used as the comprehensive statewide student assessment.

416.title: Transferring certain revenues derived from racetrack video lottery and racetrack table games
416.description: The purpose of this bill is to transfer all the funds now existing or created in the future in the Greyhound Breeding Development Fund to the Excess Lottery Revenue Fund.

417.title: Allowing an adjustment to gross income for calculating the personal income tax liability of certain retirees
417.description: Allowing an adjustment to gross income for calculating the personal income tax liability of certain retirees

418.title: Authorizing shut-in of oil and gas wells in West Virginia
418.description: Authorizing shut-in of oil and gas wells in West Virginia

419.title: Providing owner of conservation easement be given the right of first refusal
419.description: Providing owner of conservation easement be given the right of first refusal

420.title: Requiring purchases to be made at lowest retail price available at level of quality sought by the spending unit
420.description: The purpose of this bill is to eliminate master contracts or other statewide contracts that agencies must currently use to purchase certain commodities. Spending units must purchase commodities, printing and services at the lowest retail price for the spending unit's desired level of quality within a reasonable geographical market area.

421.title: Relating to deduction from jail sentence for litter cleanup
421.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide for sentence reduction of jail inmates who participate in cleaning up litter.

422.title: Creating a tax credit for improving facades in historic districts
422.description: The purpose of this bill is to create a tax credit for improving facades in historic districts. The bill provides that individuals and corporations are entitled to a twenty-five percent tax credit of the replacement cost of a historic façade. The bill sets forth conditions.

423.title: Prohibiting insurers from cancelling or failing to renew insurance policies do to the mere filing of a claim that was later denied
423.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit insurers from cancelling insurance policies doe to the mere filing of a claim that was later denied or to the policy holders inquiry about whether a loss is covered under the policy.Â The bill permits the cancellation of policies for numerous frivolous or unfounded claims.

424.title: Authorizing the Lottery Commission to introduce games whose winning tickets are determined by the outcome of a licensed horse race
424.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Lottery Commission to introduce games whose winning tickets are determined by the outcome of a licensed horse race.

425.title: Requiring the Insurance Commissioner to regulate professional bondsmen
425.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide for the regulation of the bail bondsmen business by the Insurance Commissioner.

426.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
426.title: Relating to exemptions from mandated immunizations
426.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide exemptions from mandatory immunizations.

427.title: The West Virginia Refugee Absorptive Capacity Act
427.description: The purpose of this bill is to enact the refugee absorptive capacity act; short title; definitions; state office for refugees; moratorium applications and cessations; fiscal impact assessment; and reports required.

428.title: Relating to salary increase for Regional Jail Authority employees
428.description: Relating to salary increase for Regional Jail Authority employees

429.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
429.title: Assessing the health impact of any new, or modification to, rule proposed by the Secretary of the Department of Environmental Protection
429.description: The purpose of this bill is to. require the Commissioner of Bureau for Public Health to conduct a public health impact statement assessing the health impact of any new air or water rule, or modification of an existing air or water rule, proposed by the Department of Environmental Protection to ensure that no air or water rule is promulgated without substantiating independent medical or scientific evidence that there is no detrimental public health impact from the rule. The bill also requires that the findings in the impact statement be incorporated into the proposed rule.

430.title: Relating to the right of municipalities and counties to buy real estate for delinquent taxes
430.description: The purpose of this bill is to create theÂ right of municipalities and counties to buy real estate for delinquent taxes.

431.title: Relating to advance deposit wagering
431.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow Advanced Deposit Wagering in West Virginia, to provide definitions.

432.title: Establishing a new special revenue fund, designated the Adult Drug Court Participation Fund
432.description: Establishing a new special revenue fund, designated the Adult Drug Court Participation Fund

433.title: Relating to labor; employer’s bond for wages
433.description: The purpose of this bill is to amend the procedure by which a charitable gaming licensee may appeal the Tax Commissioner’s sanctions against the licensee for violations of the charitable gaming laws, by allowing the licensee to petition the Office of Tax Appeals for an administrative hearing rather than the Tax Commissioner.

434.title: Relating generally to development of infrastructure in the state
434.description: The bill provides for the construction of a state-wide, fiber optic broadband infrastructure network, known as broadband middle mile, to be purchased and owned by the state. The bill adds and defines new terms and creates a separate infrastructure fund for broadband middle mile infrastructure projects. The bill requires certain agencies to apply for grants in furtherance of the article, provides additional powers to the Water Development Authority and creates the West Virginia Broadband Middle Mile Infrastructure Revenue Debt Service Fund. The bill authorizes the issuance of broadband middle mile revenue bonds, provides for contents of trust agreement and trustee for bonds, and specifies remedies available to bondholders, noteholders and trustees. The bill makes broadband middle mile infrastructure revenue bonds lawful investments and provides for purchase, cancellation and refunding of bonds. The bill declares that the bonds are not state debts and are exempt from state taxation.

435.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
435.title: Budget Stabilization Act of 2017
435.description: The purpose of this bill is to implement several temporary tax increases to stabilize the state budget; including establishing a 3% food tax, increasing personal income tax rates; increasing tobacco taxes; and increasing the corporate net income tax rate; all to expire effective July 1, 2021.

436.title: Relating to Capitol Complex security access
436.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow persons who regularly do business at Building 1 of the State Capitol Complex, the opportunity to get an exterior door access security card, after being subject to a background check and paying a $250 fee, upon approval of the Director of the Division of Protective Services.

437.last_action: To House Agriculture and Natural Resources
437.title: Requiring moneys collected from the sale of timber realized through management of the state-owned forests and parks be distributed on a pro rata basis
437.description: The purpose of this bill is to require the moneys collected from the sale of timber realized through management of the state-owned forests and parks be distributed on a pro rata basis to the specific forest or park that was timbered. The bill creates a special fund.

438.title: Increasing the minimum wage based upon increases in the consumer price index
438.description: The purpose of this bill is to increase the minimum wage based upon increases in the consumer price index.

439.title: Granting the State Auditor the authority to audit the books and records of local economic development authorities
439.description: The purpose of this bill is to. grant the State Auditor the authority to audit the books and records of local economic development authorities. The bill permits, in the alternative, the authority to be audited by an independent certified public accountant with copies forwarded to the county commission and the auditor.

440.title: Relating to public school education in dating violence, domestic abuse and sexual violence prevention
440.description: This purpose of this bill is to ensure that public schools integrate age-appropriate components of effective and evidence-based programs on the prevention of dating violence, domestic abuse and sexual violence into their existing programs and curricula.

441.title: Authorizing the change of charging 911 fees to land line telephone bills to being charged to electric bills
441.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the change of the charging 911 fees from land line telephone bills to electric bills.

442.title: Relating to the theft of consumer identity protections
442.description: Relating to the theft of consumer identity protections

443.title: Pothole app and map
443.description: The purpose of this bill is to require the Commissioner of Highways to develop an app and a map that permits individuals to report, and keep track of, potholes on the roads and streets of the state.

444.title: Limiting the number of days members of the Legislature may receive compensation during an extended and extraordinary session
444.description: The purpose of this bill is to limit the compensation of members of the Legislature to no more than five days in a special session where a budget bill has not been enacted.

445.title: Relating to allowing draw games winners to remain anonymous
445.description: Relating to allowing Powerball, Mega Millions and Hot Lotto ticket winners to remain anonymous

446.title: Granting priority to roadway construction, reconstruction and maintenance for roadways prone to recurring floods that hinder ingress and egress
446.description: Granting priority to roadway construction, reconstruction and maintenance for roadways prone to recurring floods that hinder ingress and egress

447.title: Relating to taxes on beer and nonintoxicating beer
447.description: The purpose of this bill is to give authority to municipalities to impose taxes on beer and nonintoxicating beer and to impose a tax on purchases of beer and nonintoxicating beer outside corporate limits of municipalities for benefit of counties and municipalities.

448.title: Clarifying the penalties for embezzlement
448.description: The purpose of this bill is to clearly define the penalties for embezzlement.

449.title: Requiring continuous monitoring of air, noise, dust and particulates
449.description: The purpose of this bill is to implement the recommendations arising out of the studies required by the passage of sections twelve, twenty-two and twenty-three of the Natural Gas Horizontal Well Control Act passed by the Legislature December 14, 2011.Â

450.title: Requiring the Commissioner of Highways to develop a state hotline for travelers to identify road hazards
450.description: color:windowtext'>The purpose of this bill is to require the Commissioner of Highways to develop a state hotline for travelers to identify road hazards; and to require the Commissioner of Highways to develop a communications plan to disseminate to the public information about known road hazards.

451.title: Relating to civil asset forfeiture
451.description: The purpose of this bill is to require the state to prove that the owner of seized property has been convicted of a crime and that the seized property was substantially related to said crime before the state can perfect title to seized property; and require that the state return seized property to its owner if the state cannot meet its evidentiary burden.

452.title: Budget and Spending Transparency Act
452.description: The purpose of this bill is to create a searchable online database containing past and recent budget and expenditure information creating and maintaining a searchable online budget database to easily access the details on how the state is spending their tax dollars and what performance results are achieved for those expenditures. The State Tax Department is authorized to establish any methods or procedures as necessary to accomplish the intent and goals of this article.

453.title: Permitting certain animal euthanasia technicians who have been certified by other states be certified animal euthanasia technicians in West Virginia
453.description: The purpose of this bill is to permit certain animal euthanasia technicians who have been certified by other states be certified animal euthanasia technicians in West Virginia.

454.title: Relating generally to applied associate of science degrees that target workforce needs
454.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize certain schools to grant applied associate of science degrees that target workforce needs; require the West Virginia State Board of Education to promulgate rules setting the minimum standards for granting applied associate of science degrees that target workforce needs; and limit the schools that grant applied associate of science degrees that target workforce needs to vocational technical schools which are accredited by the appropriate nationally recognized accrediting agency or association approved by the United States Department of Education..

455.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
455.title: Establishing a program for the licensing and regulation of out-patient substance abuse counseling programs
455.description: Establishing a program for the licensing and regulation of out-patient substance abuse counseling programs

456.title: Abolishing the West Virginia Higher Education Policy Commission
456.description: The purpose of this bill is to abolish the West Virginia Higher Education Policy Commission. The bill transfers all powers and duties of the commission relating to governance of institutions of higher education to the board of Governors of the institutions. The bill transfers all powers and duties of the commission to secure, provide, or administer financial support for educational or research purposes to the Institutions. The bill provides for the transfer and disposition of assets, property and records of the commission.  This section has been completely rewritten; therefore, it has been completely underscored.

457.title: Relating to special licenses for the retail sale of wine at festivals or fairs
457.description: The purpose of this bill is to make the special license term for the retail sale of wine at festivals or fairs one year.

458.title: Allocating disability or death benefits resulting from an occupational pneumoconiosis claim among the claimant’s employers on a proportional basis
458.description: The purpose of this bill is to require the Workers’ Compensation Commission to allocate disability or death benefits resulting from an occupational pneumoconiosis claim among the claimant’s employers on a proportional basis.

459.title: Relating to filling vacancies in certain offices
459.description: The purpose of this bill is to require vacancies in offices of state officials, United States Senators, Justices, judges, and magistrates to be filled with an individual of the same political party with which the individual vacating the office was affiliated at the time of his or her election to the vacated office.

460.title: Relating to regulation of unmanned aircraft systems
460.description: Relating to regulation of unmanned aircraft systems

461.title: Exempting certain contracts between the Department of Health and Human Resources and West Virginia University, Marshall University or the School for Osteopathic Medicine from state purchasing requirements
461.description: The purpose of this bill is to exempt certain contracts between the Department of Health and Human Resources and West Virginia University or Marshall University from state purchasing requirements.

462.title: Requiring paving contracts for state highways to have special requirements to prevent potholes
462.description: The purpose of this bill is to require paving contracts for state highways to have special requirements to prevent potholes.

463.title: Relating to eliminating county school systems and creating ten school districts
463.description: The purpose of this bill is to eliminate county boards of education and establish school districts.

464.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
464.title: Making it a felony to knowingly expose another individual to HIV
464.description: Making it a felony to knowingly expose another individual to HIV

465.title: Changing the determination of just compensation to be paid to the landowner when eminent domain is used for a pipeline
465.description: The purpose of this bill is to change the determination of "just compensation" to be paid to the landowner when eminent domain is used for a pipeline and the pipeline does not connect directly to a residential or commercial end user. Currently the common law provides that the just compensation paid to the landowner is the value to the land owners of the interest taken before the pipeline was proposed. Under the bill the just compensation will be the higher of either the value to the landowner of the landowner's interest taken or the value of the pipeline to the person or entity seeking to use eminent domain for the pipeline. And regular payments contingent upon the value of the pipeline over time may be awarded.

467.title: Requiring an inspection or inspections of any building prior to purchase or major renovation by the state
467.description: Requiring an inspection or inspections of any building prior to purchase or major renovation by the state

468.title: Prohibiting a person appointed agent under a power of attorney from exerting undue influence over the principal
468.description: 10.0pt;color:windowtext'>The purpose of this bill is to define undue influence and prohibit exoneration of a fiduciary who has exerted undue influence over a principal.

469.title: Requiring all commercial and professional drivers be fingerprinted and undergo a background check
469.description: The purpose of this bill is to require fingerprinting and background checks for all licensed professional and commercial drivers.

470.title: Relating to domestic violence victims' eligibility for unemployment compensation benefits
470.description: The purpose of this bill is to prevent an individual from being disqualified from receiving unemployment compensation benefits when their separation from employment is due to domestic violence, sexual offenses or stalking by family or household members. The bill provides that the employer is not chargeable for benefits paid when the separation from work is for those reasons.

471.title: Providing that a person when being attacked in a place that is not his or her home should retreat instead of using deadly force
471.description: Providing that a person when being attacked in a place that is not his or her home should retreat instead of using deadly force

472.title: Relating to the West Virginia Contraband Forfeiture Act
472.description: The purpose of this bill is to amend certain provisions of the West Virginia Contraband Forfeiture Act. It restates the legislative findings and purpose. The bill; requires a receipt for seized property from law enforcement and provides a procedure for replevin. The bill states purposes for forfeiture of property and the procedure for forfeiture. And the bill and provides that all moneys forfeited under the provisions of this article shall be distributed for the support of drug courts.

473.title: Relating to criminal penalties for the offenses of hunting, trapping or fishing on the lands of another person
473.description: Relating to criminal penalties for the offenses of hunting, trapping or fishing on the lands of another person

474.title: Relating to insurance coverage for breast cancer screening
474.description: The purpose of this bill is to establish insurance provisions required relating to breast cancer screenings.

475.title: Relating to public school education assessment of students for dyslexia and dyscalculia
475.description: Relating to public school education assessment of students for dyslexia and dyscalculia

476.title: Limiting recoverable damages when a patient has been transferred from health care facility to another health care facility
476.description: Limiting recoverable damages when a patient has been transferred from health care facility to another health care facility

477.title: Authorizing by ordinance a vacant building registration program
477.description: The purpose of this bill is to grant county commissions the plenary power and authority to establish by ordinance vacant building registration programs; setting forth procedures for administration and enforcement of those programs.

478.title: Providing that a vehicle driver who injures a “vulnerable road user” is guilty of reckless driving
478.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide that a vehicle driver who injures a “vulnerable road user” is guilty of reckless driving. The bill defines the term “vulnerable road user.” The bill imposes misdemeanor penalties.

479.title: Imposing a tax on cattle which is to be used to help fund the U. S. Department of Agriculture's Wildlife Services Fund
