944.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide payment to certain claimants who provided commodities and/or services to the state, but who were not paid because the agency reached its budget limit. Total amount from General Revenue:Â $208,236.95

945.title: Clarifying provisions relating to candidates unaffiliated with a political party as it relates to certificates of announcement
945.description: The purpose of this bill is to clarify provisions relating to candidates unaffiliated with a political party as it relates to certificates of announcement, preventing potential candidates registered as members of a political party from using the provisions of the section to seek candidacy for office.

946.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
946.title: Youth Mental Health Protection Act
946.description: The purpose of this bill is to protect lesbian, gay, bisexual, and transgender youth from conversion therapy, also known as sexual orientation change efforts or reparative therapy; to make legislative findings; to set forth a purpose; to define terms; to set forth a prohibition for referral services for conversion therapy; and to provide discipline for providers who violate these prohibitions.

947.title: Clarifying when a minor between the ages of 16 and 18 may be employed by or elected as a member of a volunteer fire department
947.description: The purpose of this bill is to clarify when a minor between the ages of 16 and 18 may be employed by or elected as a member of a volunteer fire department to perform fire fighting functions.

948.title: Relating to collecting rents and royalties from leases of public lands
948.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide that the rents and royalties from future mineral leases in respect of the state's rivers and streams shall be dedicated to road maintenance and paving. The bill also permits counties that do not have state parks to retain rents and royalties from such leases.

949.title: Reallocating and dedicating three percent of oil and gas severance tax revenues to the oil and gas producing counties
949.description: Reallocating and dedicating three percent of oil and gas severance tax revenues to the oil and gas producing counties

950.title: Relating to standardization of service credit for hourly employees who become members of the Public Employees Retirement System
950.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide standardization of service credit for hourly employees hired for the first time after July 1, 2015, who become members of the Public Employees Retirement System. The bill permits those employees with 150 hours of work paid during a month to receive one month’s credit for retirement purposes.

951.title: Relating to the “Equal Pay Act of 2018”
951.description: The purpose of this bill is to be known as the “Equal Pay Act of 2018”.Â The bill makes it an unlawful discriminatory practice for an employer to make a condition of employment, or prohibit an employee from disclosing information about his or her wages, benefits, or other compensation, or sharing information regarding any other employee’s wages, benefits, or other compensation.

952.title: Establishing that a candidate must resign to run for another public office
952.description: The purpose of this bill is to establish that no officer may qualify as a candidate for other office until he or she has resigned from the officer currently held.

953.title: Relating to homestead exemption by a disabled veteran who has a 100 percent permanent and total service-connected disability
953.description: The purpose of this bill is to exempt the total amount of assessed value of a homestead owned and occupied by a disabled veteran who has a 100 percent permanent and total service-connected disability.

954.last_action: To House Prevention and Treatment of Substance Abuse
954.title: Requiring bail bondsman and bail bond enforcer be subject to random drug testing
954.description: The purpose of this bill is to requiring bail bondsman and bail bond enforcers to submit results of drug test to Chief Judge in each jurisdiction; requiring bail bondsman be subject to random drug testing; creating penalty of suspension or termination for failure of, or refusal to submit to, drug test; establishing that drug test records be public.

955.title: Clarifying the authority of the State Fire Commission in adopting a State Building Code
955.description: The purpose of this bill is to remove the language making it mandatory that the State Fire Commission adopt energy codes.

956.title: Allowing vehicles operated by transportation supervisors employed by county boards of education to use red flashing warning lights
956.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow vehicles operated by transportation directors and transportation supervisors employed by county boards of education to use red flashing warning lights.

957.title: Revised Uniform Athlete Agents Act
957.description: The purpose of this bill is to create the Revised Uniform Athlete Agents Act; create a short title; define terms; requireÂ registration for athlete agent; void contracts if athlete agent not registered; create application process and requirements for athlete agents; establish reciprocal registration if certain conditions are met; provide authority of secretary to issue or deny applications; provide renewal requirements; provide power of secretary to suspend, revoke, or refuse to renew registration; provide for temporary registration; establish fees; require terms for validity of contract; require notice to educational institution; provide student right to cancel contract within specified period; require athlete agent retain certain records; establish prohibited conduct of athlete agent; establish criminal penalties; establish civil remedies for violations of act; establish civil penalties; require uniformity of application in construction of act; establish relation to the Electronic Signatures In Global And National Commerce Act; and provide severability.

958.title: Providing for a uniform and efficient system of broadband conduit installation
958.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide for a uniform and efficient system of broadband conduit installation coinciding with the construction, maintenance or improvement of highways and right-of-way under the oversight of the Division of Highways.

959.title: Permitting teachers to retire after 25 years of contributing service regardless of age
959.description: The purpose of this bill is to permit teachers to retire after 25 years of contributing service regardless of age.

960.title: Relating to failure of employers to make contributions on behalf of employees to a retirement plan
960.description: The purpose of this bill is to make it a criminal offense for any participating public employer of any retirement system administered by the Consolidated Public Retirement Board to fail to make required contributions, and authorizes the State Auditor, county commission and sheriff to withhold any money due the participating public employer by the state or county and to remit the monies to the applicable retirement system.

961.title: Changing the persons responsible for the taxes on soft drinks and soft drink syrups
961.description: The purpose of this bill is to change the persons responsible for the taxes on soft drinks and soft drink syrups.

962.title: Creating the West Virginia Sentencing Commission
962.description: The purpose of this bill is to create the West Virginia Sentencing Commission and provide for its powers and duties.

963.title: Creating newly-established small business tax credits
963.description: The purpose of this bill is to create a newly-established small business tax credit. It provides tax credits against Corporate Net Income Tax and Personal Income Tax in the amount of certain property taxes paid.

964.title: Relating to judicial review of contested cases under the West Virginia Department of Health and Human Resources Board of Review
964.description: The purpose of this bill is to correct an error in this section by changing “not” to “or “in §9-2-13(d).

965.title: Relating to the assignment of certain benefits in dental care insurance coverage
965.description: The purpose of this bill is to require dental insurance plans to honor an assignment, made in writing by the person covered under the policy, of payments due under the policy to a dentist or a dental corporation for services provided to the covered person that are covered under the policy.

966.title: Relating to animal abuse
966.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit activities connected with bestiality; establish criminal penalties; provide for forfeiture of animals, payment of associated costs, and restrictions on owning animals upon conviction; and require psychiatric evaluation and counseling.

967.title: Prohibiting confidential settlement terms of a contested case involving sexual harassment, sexual abuse, or sexual assault
967.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit confidential settlement terms of a contested case involving sexual harassment, sexual abuse, or sexual assault, and to provide penalties.

968.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
968.title: Relating to designation of hospitals for stroke treatment
968.description: The purpose of this bill is to add a designation as a thrombectomy-capable stroke center.Â It also modifies the make-up of the advisory committee, requires approval of legislative rules by the advisory committee prior to filing and prohibits certain inspections of hospitals conducted by the Department of Health and Human Resources.

969.title: Citizen and State Accountability Act
969.description: The purpose of this bill is to create Citizen and State Accountability Act. The bill authorizes departments, agencies, and officials of state or local government to apply for major and minor grant agreements. The bill establishes the requirements for applying for the grant agreements. The bill requires reports. The bill requires written consent for major grant requests by the Governor. The bill permits the Governor to prohibit the submission of a minor grant application or prohibit the acceptance of any such grant. The bill repeals all statutes that conflict with the Citizen and State Accountability Act. The bill defines terms.

970.title: Permitting parents to petition the court for visitation on Mother’s Day and Father’s Day
970.description: The purpose of this bill is to permit parents to petition the court for visitation on Mother’s Day and Father’s Day.

971.title: Allowing the Alcohol Beverage Control Commissioner to issue special one-day licenses for charitable events
971.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow the Alcohol Beverage Control Commissioner to issue special one-day licenses for the retail sale of nonintoxicating beer and alcoholic liquors to a duly organized nonprofit corporation, limited liability entity or an association having received federal tax-exempt status, when raising money for artistic, athletic, charitable, educational or religious purposes.

972.title: Limiting the use of records of criminal conviction to disqualify a person from receiving a license or other authorization to practice an occupation
972.description: The purpose of this bill is to limit the use of criminal records as a basis to disqualify a person from receiving a license or other authorization to practice an occupation. These limits apply to state agencies, offices, boards, commissions, and to political subdivisions that grant licenses, certifications, registrations, occupational permits, and other forms of legal authorization. Licensing authorities must be specific about the types of convictions that would disqualify a person from receiving or keeping a license to practice and state agencies must update their rules to follow the requirements of this act. This bill would also prevent political subdivisions from creating license requirements for an occupation if the political subdivision does not already have requirement for that occupation.

973.title: Allowing off duty members and officers of the department of public safety to guard private property
973.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize off-duty state troopers to accept employment to provide security services.

974.title: Adding applicants for child care and foster care to background checks under the West Virginia Clearance for Access: Registry and Employment Screening Act
974.description: The purpose of this bill is to add applicants for child care and foster care subject to background checks under the West Virginia Clearance for Access: Registry and Employment Screening Act.

975.title: Extending the time that teachers may pay into the State Teachers Retirement System
975.description: The purpose of this bill is to extend the time for certain teachers to pay into the Teachers Retirement System.

976.title: Authorizing the acupuncture board to issue certificates to perform auricular acudetox therapy
976.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the West Virginia Acupuncture Board to issue certificates for performing auricular acudetox therapy.

977.title: Expanding the amount of PROMISE scholarship funds awarded to persons majoring in science, technology, engineering and mathematics
977.description: The purpose of this bill is to increase PROMISE scholarships to persons majoring in STEM (Science, technology, engineering and mathematics) fields to pay the full cost of tuition, room and board.

978.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
978.title: Nondiscrimination in Involuntary Denial of Treatment Act
978.description: The purpose of this bill is to create the Nondiscrimination in Involuntary Denial of Treatment Act.

979.title: Providing that state retirees’ insurance benefits be restored to the benefit levels that existed in 2015
979.description: The purpose of this bill is to providing that state retirees’ insurance benefits be restored to the benefit levels that existed in 2015.

980.title: Increasing the salaries of public school teachers
980.description: The purpose of this bill is to increase the salaries of public school teachers over a five-year period.

981.title: Exempting all-terrain vehicles and utility terrain vehicles used as farm equipment from the sales tax
981.description: The purpose of this bill is to exempt from the sales tax all-terrain vehicles and utility terrain vehicles used as farm equipment.

982.title: Establishing a one percent tax on food for five years
982.description: The purpose of this bill is to establish a one per cent tax on food for five years. The bill requires the tax proceeds be used to fund the Public Employees Insurance Agency. The bill permitting the tax to end sooner if other funding sources are utilized. The bill prohibits municipalities from imposing a sales tax on food.

983.title: West Virginia Addictions Treatment and Recovery Fund
983.description: West Virginia Addictions Treatment and Recovery Fund

984.title: Relating to use of state funds for advertising to promote a public official or government office
984.description: The purpose of this bill is to clarify the definition of “advertising” relating to the promotion of a public official or government office and to distinguish between advertising and purely educational materials and to make allowances for press releases intended for legitimate news and informational purposes.

985.title: Exempting all monetary benefits derived from retirement income from personal income tax obligations for individuals moving into the state
985.description: The purpose of this bill is to encourage retirees to move to West Virginia by exempting all monetary benefits derived from retirement income from personal income tax obligations for individuals moving into the state who had not lived in the state for one year immediately preceding the move.

986.title: Allowing counties and municipalities to levy a sales tax on food and beverages sold at restaurants
986.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow local governments to levy a sales tax on food and beverages sold at restaurants. The bill provides for county and municipality options. The bill limits the total tax to three percent. The bill limits a municipal tax to two percent. The bill sets forth the procedures for counties and municipalities to use to impose the tax. The bill requires publication. The bill sets forth how the collected tax may be used. The bill sets forth apportionment of the tax between local jurisdictions. The bill sets forth exemptions from the tax. The bill defines terms. The bill provides criminal penalties.

987.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
987.title: Permitting persons who voluntarily enroll in a drug rehabilitation program to be included in an existing pilot program
987.description: This purpose of this bill is to permit persons who voluntarily enroll in drug rehabilitation to participate in a pilot program. The bill authorizes the Department of Health and Human Resources to care for the children of those persons who voluntarily enroll in drug rehabilitation and who are participating in the pilot program.

988.title: Allowing county commissions to impose an amusement tax
988.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow county commissions to impose an amusement tax.

989.title: Authorizing public schools to distribute excess food to students
989.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize public schools to create a Shared Table program to allow for distribution of excess school food to students and others who have food insecurities.

990.title: Relating to the West Virginia Life And Health Insurance Guaranty Association Act
990.description: The purpose of this bill is to ensure the West Virginia Life and Health Insurance Guaranty Association assesses member insurers in a fair and reasonable manner and has sufficient assessment capacity for all insolvencies, and to update Article 26A to maintain consistency with the National Association of Insurance Commissioners Life and Health Insurance Guaranty Association Model Act.

991.title: Revising existing standards and establishing burden of proof imposed on civil litigants seeking to circumvent corporate structure
991.description: The purpose of this bill is to revise existing standards and establish the burden of proof imposed on civil litigants seeking to circumvent corporate structure in civil litigation.

992.title: Relating to mandatory inter-board reporting by licensees or registrants of the boards of medicine, osteopathic medicine, nursing
992.description: The purpose of this bill is to require licensees or registrants of the boards of medicine, osteopathic medicine, registered professional nursing, and practical nursing to report the professional incompetence or inability to practice of any licensee or registrant of his or her own board or of the other three listed boards.

993.title: Relating to net metering
993.description: The purpose of this bill is to modify the method for determining rebate or discounts to customers regarding net metering of electricity. It also requires the Public Service Commission to require compliance with certain national codes.

994.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
994.title: Relating to generic drug products
994.description: The purpose of this bill is to amend the way savings derived from the filling of generic drugs are distributed. The provisions of this section as amended in 2018 are to apply retroactively to pharmacy transactions occurring since 1978.

995.title: Discontinuing the West Virginia Racing Commission special account known as the West Virginia Greyhound Breeding Development Fund
995.description: Â The purpose of this bill is to discontinue the West Virginia Racing Commission special account known as the West Virginia Greyhound Breeding Development Fund for certain racetracks; to transfer some moneys in the West Virginia Greyhound Breeding Development Fund to the state Excess Lottery Revenue Fund for appropriation by the Legislature; to require that some moneys previously required to be directed to the West Virginia Greyhound Breeding Development Fund be redirected to the state Excess Lottery Revenue Fund for appropriation by the Legislature; requiring that upon transfer of moneys from the West Virginia Greyhound Breeding Development Fund to the state Excess Lottery Revenue Fund, a certain amount be withheld and deposited in the special account known as the “administration, promotion, education, capital improvement and greyhound adoption programs to include spaying and neutering account;” to require that all moneys previously required to be directed into any fund or paid for the purpose of funding purses, awards or provide any other funding for greyhound races be redirected to the state Excess Lottery Revenue Fund for appropriation by the Legislature; to eliminate the requirement that an applicant for a dog racing license race a minimum number of dates to qualify for such license; to eliminate the requirement that an applicant for a dog racing license race a minimum number of dates to or to contract to receive telecasts and accept wagers; to eliminate the requirement that a video lottery licensee at a dog track must hold a racing license to renew a video lottery license or racetrack table games license; to eliminate the requirement, for a video lottery licensee at a dog track, that operational video lottery must be located in the same building or structure as a racetrack and area where pari-mutuel wagering is permitted; to eliminate the requirement that an applicant for a video lottery license or license renewal at a dog track must provide evidence of the existence of an agreement regarding proceeds from lottery terminals with certain parties; to eliminate the requirement that an applicant for a racetrack table games license at a dog track must race a certain number of days to qualify for such license; to eliminate the requirement that a video lottery licensee at a dog track must hold a racing license to conduct simulcast racing; and making certain exceptions for racetracks in Ohio County.

996.title: Shifting funding from the Landfill Closure Assistance Fund to local solid waste authorities
996.description: The purpose of this bill is to shift funding from the Landfill Closure Assistance Fund, which was set up in 1991 to properly close old landfills across the state, to local solid waste authorities.Â According to the 2017 West Virginia Solid Waste Management Plan, 28 of the 35 old landfills have been properly remediated by the fund.Â Given the progress made towards closure of the old landfills, the portion of the solid waste fee assessed on landfill deposits, which is currently sent to the fund, is being reduced in order to accommodate an in-kind increase in the portion of the solid waste fee charged by county or regional solid waste authorities to fund various recycling, litter control, and other locally important solid waste program.Â Additionally, this bill would allow for a reduction in the use of county commission/county tax dollars currently utilized to support various recycling, litter control, and other locally important solid waste programs.

997.title: Relating to persons required to obtain a license to engage in the business of currency exchange
997.description: The purpose of this bill is to assist in the streamlining of filing with the West Virginia Securities Commission, and to potentially reduce the cost to filers by allowing use of a national database to make filings.

998.title: Providing a special license plate for pollinators
998.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide a special license plate for pollinators. The bill also sets a fee.

999.title: Relating to the Hatfield-McCoy Recreation Authority
999.description: The purpose of this bill is to add the counties of Braxton, Clay, Fayette, Nicholas, and Webster to the definition of participating county or counties. The bill prohibits persons from consuming non-intoxicating beer, non-intoxicating craft beer, or wine at any time within the Hatfield-McCoy Recreation Area; prohibits a child under the age of six from being allowed on any trail within the Hatfield-McCoy Recreation Area; prohibits children under the age of eight years who are required to be in a child passenger safety device while occupying a motor vehicle from being allowed on any trail within the Hatfield-McCoy Recreation Area; and requires all persons operating or riding upon an ATV, UTV, or motorcycle to follow the manufacturer’s recommendations for that vehicle relating to age and size limitations for operators and passengers.Â

1000.title: Uniform Commercial Real Estate Receivership Act
1000.description: The purpose of this bill is to enact the Uniform Commercial Real Estate Receivership Act in West Virginia. This law has been developed by the National Conference of Commissioners on Uniform State Laws to establish uniformity among the states regarding the appointment and powers of receivers, person appointed by a court to take possession of the property of another involved in matters before the court and to receive, collect, care for, and dispose of the property or the fruits of the property on before of the court in a fair and equitable manner. This is an entirely new article of the code.

1001.title: Relating to oil and gas permits not to be on flat well royalty leases
1001.description: The purpose of this bill is to clarify the royalty owed to a royalty owner in an oil and gas lease.

1002.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
1002.title: Relating to legalizing cannabis production, sales and adult consumption
1002.description: The purpose of this bill is to legalize the personal use and possession of cannabis by adults; providing for a county option election to allow for the production and sales in that county; providing for regulation by the Bureau of Health; authorizing an excise and local sales tax on cannabis; prohibiting underage use; and preserving current laws relating to allowing employers and property owners to prohibit use or possession.

1003.title: Relating to the renewal of automobile insurance policies
1003.description: The purpose of this bill is to modify the requirements for renewal of automobile insurance policies.

1004.title: Permitting county commissions to set compensation of election officials
1004.description: The purpose of this bill is to permit county commissions to determine compensation of election officials at elections; exception.

1005.title: Authorizing certain motor vehicle manufacturers to operate as new car dealers
1005.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize certain zero emission motor vehicle manufacturers to operate as new car dealers in West Virginia.

1006.title: Requiring urban renewal authorities to submit proposed urban renewal projects to the affected local county boards of health
1006.description: The purpose of this bill is to require urban renewal authorities to submit active, amended and proposed urban renewal projects and plans to the affected local county boards of health for review and comment. The bill requires urban renewal authorities to meet with municipalities and communities regrading those projects and plans. The bill requires urban renewal authorities to make reports and make them available to the affected local county boards of health and local residents.

1007.title: Establishing the responsibilities of persons providing credit card processing services in the state
1007.description: The purpose of this bill is to establish the responsibilities of persons providing credit card processing services in the state. The bill would prevent the current practice of where a company has charged as much as $18,000 to a small merchant for terminating the contract one month early. The bill sets forth the required disclosures and prohibitions. The bill establishes a maximum early termination fee. The bill sets forth penalties and enforcement. The bill sets forth its applicability and exclusions.

1008.title: Exempting spouses of active military personnel from fees associated with occupational or professional licensing
1008.description: The purpose of this bill is to exempt spouses of active military personnel from fees associated with occupational or professional licensing.

1009.title: Relating to charges for municipal services
1009.description: The purpose of this bill is to stop the collection of municipal user fees from state officers and employees.

1010.title: Relating to rate filings for personal lines of insurance
1010.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow for the creation of a flex band rating system for personal lines of insurance.

1011.last_action: To House Agriculture and Natural Resources
1011.title: Industrial Hemp Research and Development Grant Fund
1011.description: The purpose of this bill is to the create an Industrial Hemp Research and Development Grant Fund and an Industrial Hemp Research Fund to conduct research and development of industrial hemp for commercial purposes.Â The bill authorizes the collection of fees to support the grant fund and research fund, along with appropriations from the Legislature and moneys form other sources.

1012.title: Allowing victims of certain crimes to get a restraining order prohibiting convicted persons from contacting or living in proximity to the victim
1012.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow crime victims to petition a court to obtain restraining orders to prevent persons who committed specified crimes against the victim from living in proximity or knowingly coming into contact with the victim, if the victim proves to the court that this will cause or has caused the victim emotional distress.

1013.title: Adding the crimes of murder and armed robbery to the list of offenses for which a prosecutor may apply for an order authorizing interception
1013.description: The purpose of this bill is to include the offenses of murder and armed robbery for which a prosecutor could apply for an order authorizing interception.

1014.last_action: To House Small Business, Entrepreneurship and Economic Development
1014.title: West Virginia New Markets Jobs Act
1014.description: The purpose of this bill is to establish a West Virginia business growth in low-income communities tax credit.

1015.title: Prohibiting the awarding of public contracts to vendors and subcontractors indebted to the state or its political subdivisions
1015.description: The purpose of this bill is to prevent state agencies and political subdivisions from contracting with vendors and major subcontractors on public construction contracts if the vendor or subcontractor has outstanding debts to the state. This prohibition would apply to any subcontractor whose portion of the contract or potential contract would amount to more than $25,000, including labor and materials.

1016.title: Establishing a special memorial day to be known as Juneteenth honoring human rights and the end of slavery in the United States
1016.description: The purpose of this bill is to make June 19 a special memorial day to be known as Juneteenth honoring human rights and the end of slavery in the United States; and encouraging all counties and municipalities in the state to do the same.

1017.title: Requiring agencies of the state, county or municipality that issue citations to furnish a copy of the rule or law to the person accused
1017.description: The purpose of this bill is to require agencies of the state, county or municipality that have authority to issue citations for violations of rules or law, to furnish a copy of the rule or law to the person accused.

1018.title: Relating to prostituting a child by a parent, guardian, custodian or other person in a position of trust
1018.description: The purpose of this bill is to make it a crime for a parent, guardian, custodian or other person in a position of trust to prostitute a child. The bill establishes criminal penalties.

1019.title: Requiring contractors to provide for the safety of the public during construction projects
1019.description: The purpose of this bill is to require contractors to provide for the safety of the public during construction projects.

1020.title: Relating to the establishment of substance abuse treatment facilities
1020.description: The purpose of this bill is to include facilities that provide peer-based services when the Secretary of Health and Human Resources establishes additional beds for purposes of providing substance abuse treatment services.

1021.title: Relating to the general provisions for judicial review
1021.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide for judicial review of appealed decisions of the Air Quality Board, the Environmental Quality Board, and Surface Mind Board directly to the Supreme Court of Appeals of West Virginia except in certain cases.

1022.title: Modifying bail requirements
1022.description: The purpose of this bill is to modify misdemeanor bail requirements.

1023.title: Relating to the State Road Construction Account
1023.description: The purpose of this bill is to require that expenditures from the State Road Construction Account be supplemental to certain funds scheduled to be allocated for certain projects in the counties eligible for projects funded from the account.

1025.last_action: To House Prevention and Treatment of Substance Abuse
1025.title: Making it a felony to knowingly house drug traffickers
1025.description: The purpose of this bill is to make it a felony to knowingly house a drug trafficker and to establish penalties for the offense.

1026.title: Relating to elections of judges
1026.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide that the election of justices of the Supreme Court of Appeals; circuit court judges, magistrates and family court judges is at general elections.

1027.title: Relating to the accrued benefit of retirees in the Deputy Sheriff Retirement System
1027.description: The purpose of this bill is to modify the Deputy Sheriff Retirement System accrued benefit for Deputy Sheriff Retirement System members to 2.75 percent beginning July, 1, 2018.

1028.title: Relating to assessment value of wind turbines
1028.description: The purpose of this bill is to permit counties to assess wind turbines in wind power projects at values ranging from salvage value to true and actual value.

1030.last_action: To House Fire Departments and Emergency Medical Services
1030.title: Relating to supplemental Medicaid and Medicare reimbursements for ground emergency medical transportation services
1030.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide that an eligible provider may receive supplemental Medicaid reimbursement and reimbursement from Medicare, if available, in addition to the rate of payment that the provider would otherwise receive, for ground emergency medical transportation services, including ground transport service by paid fire and rescue services, or volunteer fire departments; and that the supplemental reimbursement shall be equal to the amount of federal financial participation the department receives as a result of claims submitted for expenditures for services.

1031.title: Requiring free feminine hygiene products in grades 6 through 12
1031.description: The purpose of this bill is to require county boards of education to provide free feminine hygiene products in grades 6 through 12.

1032.title: Mountain State Employee Compensation Realignment Act
1032.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow employees to elect to receive compensation in the amount of the premium the State would otherwise pay for their health insurance under the Public Employees Insurance Agency and to sunset the Public Employees Insurance Agency.

1033.title: Allowing certain tax information to be shared with the Director of Purchasing Division, Department of Administration, and State Auditor
1033.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow the Tax Commissioner to share certain state tax information with the Director of the Purchasing Division, Department of Administration; and the State Auditor.

1034.title: Relating to pecuniary interest of county and district officers, teachers and school officials in contracts
1034.description: The purpose of this bill is to make an exception to the prohibition preventing county and district officers, teachers and school officials from having a pecuniary interest in contracts when the contract is for goods or supplies, has been put out for competitive bid and is awarded based upon lowest cost.

1035.title: Establishing guidelines for the substitution of certain biological pharmaceuticals
1035.description: Â The purpose of this bill is to provide definitions for biological and biosimilar products and clarify when a pharmacist may substitute a prescribed biological product.

1036.title: Relating to residency requirements for people entitled to vote and people eligible to register to vote
1036.description: The purpose of this bill is to amend the residency requirements for people entitled to vote and people eligible to register to vote by adding a definition for the phrase “legal resident.”

1037.title: Requiring any newly appointed chief executive of a municipal law-enforcement agency to be a certified law-enforcement officer
1037.description: The purpose of this bill is to require any newly appointed chief executive of a municipal law-enforcement agency to be a certified law-enforcement officer. The bill provides that current chief executives are unaffected by this requirement.

1038.title: Requiring health care insurance policies to provide coverage for services performed by a pharmacist
1038.description: The purpose of this bill is to require health care insurance policies to provide coverage for services performed by a pharmacist.

1039.title: Relating to transfers and enrollment policies for students in public schools
1039.description: The purpose of this bill is to modify the transfer and enrollment policies for students in public schools.

1040.title: Relating to oath by municipal official certifying list of delinquent business and occupation taxes
1040.description: The purpose of this bill is to clarify language in the oath required to be signed by a municipal official certifying the amounts of delinquency for B & O taxes in a published list.Â The bill permits the certification to be as of a date certain instead of the date the oath is signed or the list is published since some delinquencies may be paid between the time of certification and the actual date of publication.Â The bill clarifies that the official signing the oath is not subject to the misdemeanor penalties in §11-10-5d(c) of the code.

1041.title: West Virginia Natural Resources Permanent Fund
1041.description: The purpose of this bill is to create a special fund to receive revenue from severance taxes and other source related to minerals and then use the income from the fund to be distributed to the individual citizens of West Virginia.

1042.title: Requiring that a deputy sheriff be paid a salary of not less than $10.50 per hour
1042.description: The purpose of this bill is to require that deputy sheriffs be paid no less than $10.50 per hour.

1043.title: Relating to a prime contractor’s responsibility for wages and benefits
1043.description: The purpose of this bill is to repeal Code, §21-5-7 requiring a prime contractor to be responsible for wages and benefits owed by subcontractor, under certain circumstances.

1044.last_action: To House Prevention and Treatment of Substance Abuse
1044.title: Making it a misdemeanor for a person to knowingly allow a felony drug offense to be committed on his or her property
1044.description: The purpose of this bill is to make it a misdemeanor for a person to knowingly allow a felony drug offense to be committed on his or her property. The bill creates a duty to report. The bill creates criminal penalties. The bill allows a private cause of action.

1045.title: Relating to the executive secretary of the Health Professional Licensing Boards
1045.description: The purpose of this bill is to require the executive secretary of the health professional licensing boards to designate a victims advocate.

1046.title: Relating to payment by paper warrant
1046.description: The purpose of this bill is to establish dates for the processing of paper checks.Â The bill also authorizes a fee for processing of checks outside the scheduled dates.

1047.title: Exempting certain hygiene products from sales tax
1047.description: The purpose of this bill is to exempt feminine hygiene products and diapers from state sales tax.

1048.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
1048.title: Increasing the tobacco products excise tax
1048.description: The purpose of this bill is to increase the tobacco products excise tax with the increased revenue be used by the Public Employees Insurance Agency to reduce employees premiums.

1049.title: Adding a magistrate position to serve Raleigh County
1049.description: The purpose of this bill is to add a magistrate to serve Raleigh County.

1050.title: Providing an annual annuity adjustment of 1 percent for eligible deputy sheriff retirants and surviving spouses
1050.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide an annual annuity adjustment of 1 percent for eligible deputy sheriff retirants and surviving spouses. The bill sets a minimum amount of employer contribution.

1051.title: Implementing a process for counties to obtain grants from an existing federal fund designated the Help America Vote Act Fund
1051.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide for a county grant program in addition to the existing loan program consistent with the HAVA State Plan.

1052.title: Reinstating the film tax credits
1052.description: The purpose of this bill is to reinstate the film tax credits removed by this session of the Legislature in SB 263.

1053.title: Allowing public service districts to accept payment by credit card
1053.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow public service districts to accept payment by credit card under certain conditions.

1054.last_action: To House Prevention and Treatment of Substance Abuse
1054.title: Imposing a special excise tax on Schedule II controlled drugs
1054.description: The purpose of this bill is to impose an excise tax on Schedule II controlled drugs on drug manufacturers and distributors selling these drugs in the state. The tax would fund substance abuse treatment and help pay public employees’ insurance premiums.

1055.last_action: To House Small Business, Entrepreneurship and Economic Development
1055.title: Creating a matching program for the small business innovation and research program and the small business technology transfer program
1055.description: The purpose of this bill is to create a matching program for the Small Business Innovation and Research (SBIR) program and the Small Business Technology Transfer (STTR) program.

1056.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
1056.title: Establishing a pilot program to develop school-based mental and behavioral health services
1056.description: The purpose of this bill is to require the state Department of Education to develop a pilot program to provide mental and behavioral health services as an alternative to suspending students for disruptive behaviors.

1057.title: Relating to where an application for a marriage license may be made
1057.description: The purpose of this bill is to permit parties from two different counties in West Virginia to apply for and be issued a marriage license in any county in this state. The bill puts state residents from different counties on the same basis as two out of state residents.

1058.last_action: To House Fire Departments and Emergency Medical Services
1058.title: Recognition of Emergency Medical Services Personnel Licensure Interstate Compact
1058.description: The purpose of this bill is to enact the Recognition of Emergency Medical Services Personnel Licensure Interstate Compact. The bill enters the state into the compact with all jurisdictions that also enact the compact.

1059.title: Relating to the registration of lobbyists
1059.description: The purpose of this bill is to amend the requirements for reporting by lobbyists, by requiring annual registration and requiring the reporting of a general description of subjects on which the lobbyist has lobbied. It also requires the disclosure of the bill numbers of any bills and any rules on which they have lobbied, as well as the general amount of time spent on each bill or rule.

1060.title: Requiring school counselors in public schools to spend 100 percent of their time on comprehensive school counseling programs
1060.description: The purpose of this bill is to require school counselors in public schools to spend 100 percent of their time on comprehensive school counseling programs. The bill also requires county boards to ensure that school counselors are not assigned administrative or clerical duties as part of their regular work assignment or while students are present.

1061.title: Providing the Board of Barbers and Cosmetologists the authority to establish an apprenticeship program for cosmetologists
1061.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow the Board of Barbers and Cosmetologists to establish an apprenticeship program for cosmetologists.

1062.title: Requiring the mineral estate of an unknown owner be sold to the legal surface owner at the fair market value of the mineral interest
1062.description: Requiring the mineral estate of an unknown owner be sold to the legal surface owner at the fair market value of the mineral interest

1063.title: Relating to the definition of a raffle
1063.description: The purpose of this bill is to amend the definition of raffle to include raffles conducted by electronic means.

1064.title: Requiring applicants for new and renewed drivers’ licenses to be asked if they desire to be organ donors
1064.description: The purpose of this bill is to require applicants for new and renewed drivers’ licenses to be asked if they desire to be organ donors.

1065.last_action: To House Veterans' Affairs and Homeland Security
1065.title: Prohibiting counties, municipalities, and cities from passing any sanctuary ordinances, policies, and procedures
1065.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit counties, municipalities, and cities from passing any sanctuary ordinances, policies, and procedures.

1066.title: Refugee Information Act
1066.description: The purpose of this bill is to enact the Refugee Information Act.

1068.title: Increasing the salaries of circuit court judges, family court judges, and magistrates
1068.description: The purpose of this bill is to increase the salaries of circuit court judges, family court judges, and magistrates by enacting into law the recommendations contained in the 2017 Final Report of the West Virginia Judicial Compensation Commission with regard to those positions.

1069.title: Establishing the Entrepreneurship and Innovation Investment Fund in the West Virginia Development Office
1069.description: The purpose of this bill is to create a special revenue fund to be used by the West Virginia Development Office and known as the Entrepreneurship and Innovation Investment Fund.

1070.title: Modernizing rental car interactions
1070.description: The purpose of this bill is to modernize rental car interactions. The bill permits digital and electronic rentals. The bill provides that a rental car provider has met certain obligations when the renter has not executed a rental agreement or interacts with an employee of the provider. The bill defines terms.

1071.last_action: To House Veterans' Affairs and Homeland Security
1071.title: Including a line item on all personal income tax returns giving taxpayers the option to donate to veterans
1071.description: The purpose of this bill is to require the Tax Commissioner to include a line item on all personal income tax returns giving taxpayers the option to make a donation to veterans. The bill requires the Commissioner of the Division of Motor Vehicles to include a line item on all vehicle registrations giving applicants the option to make a donation to veterans. The bill requires the commissioners to transfer all collected funds to the Division of Veterans Affairs who shall distribute those funds to veterans’ groups. The bill requires yearly reports.

1072.last_action: To House Prevention and Treatment of Substance Abuse
1072.title: appoint the Attorney General or an assistant of Relating to the Attorney General as a special prosecutor to enforce provisions of the Uniform Controlled Substances Act
1072.description: The purpose of this bill is to address the opioid epidemic by authorizing prosecuting attorneys to appoint the Attorney General or an assistant of the Attorney General as a special prosecutor to enforce provisions of the Uniform Controlled Substances Act.

1073.title: Relating to the definition of an “employee” for purposes of payment of minimum wages, maximum hours, and overtime compensation
1073.description: The purpose of this bill is to exclude seasonal amusement park workers from the definition of “employee” for purposes of payment of minimum wages, maximum hours, and overtime compensation.

1074.title: Relating to the severance tax on oil and gas produced from low producing wells
1074.description: The purpose of this bill is to remove the severance tax on oil and gas produced from low producing wells.

1075.title: Assessing the college-and career-readiness of 11th and 12th grade students
1075.description: The purpose of this bill is to eliminate the requirement that a student placed in transitional education programs as a high school senior must re-take a college-and career-readiness examination or similar assessment of readiness if the student has already taken the examination or assessment as a junior.

1077.last_action: To House Veterans' Affairs and Homeland Security
1077.title: Relating to property exempt from taxation for military and veterans who have been honorably discharged
1077.description: The purpose of this bill is to permit active members of the United States military and veterans who have been honorably discharged from service to elect one item, either real or personal to be exempt from the payment of various taxes.

1078.title: Ban-the-Box Act
1078.description: The purpose of this bill is to enact the Ban-the-Box Act which prohibits public employers from asking applicants for employment to disclose information concerning the applicant’s criminal record or history, under certain circumstances.

1079.title: Relating to cruelty to animals
1079.description: The purpose of this bill is to amend the statute relating to cruelty to animals.Â The bill provides definitions of “food”, “water”, “shelter” and “treatment”.Â It provides specifics for tethering an animal.Â The bill includes for seizure of an animal for violations in addition to increasing criminal penalties.Â Finally, the bill provides that a person in violation of this statute for a second time shall be added to a state-wide, publicly available, do not adopt or sell registry.

1080.title: Creating a statutory right to petition circuit and family courts for sibling visitation
1080.description: The purpose of this bill is to create a statutory right for siblings to petition a circuit or family court for visitation with their minor child siblings.

1081.title: Relating to a one percent supplement to retirement benefits for certain retirees and beneficiaries
1081.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide a one percent raise in retirement benefits to certain members or beneficiaries of members of the Public Employees Retirement System.

1082.title: Relating to the final day of filing announcements of candidates for a political office
1082.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide that on the final day of filing announcements of candidates for a political office the deadline is 11:59 p.m. The bill requires that the office of the Secretary of State be open until that time; and that the offices of the County Clerks of each county be open from 12 p. m. until 6 p. m. on that date.

1083.title: Increasing frequency of the State Police updating the state sex offender registry
1083.description: The purpose of this bill is to require the State Police to update the Sex Offender Registry at least every three weeks.

1085.title: Relating to development of interests in natural gas and oil
1085.description: The purpose of this bill is to establish and define rights of mineral estate owners, surface owners, royalty owners, and operators for development of oil and gas interests through cotenancy in production, to authorize development of oil and gas through agreements for horizontal well drilling, and to levy an additional amount in tax for the severance of natural gas to be distributed to all counties and used to supplement teacher salaries.

1086.title: Providing an exemption from use tax for sales of tangible personal property, custom software, or services generated through affiliate marketing
1086.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide an exemption from use tax for sales of tangible personal property, custom software, or services generated through affiliate marketing by a retailer who has no other nexus to the state. The bill clarifies that affiliate marketing does not create nexus for the purposes of the imposition and collection of use tax. The bill defines the term, “affiliate marketing.”

1087.title: Relating to insurance unfair trade practices
1087.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit the use of a person’s credit history in certain insurance transactions involving passenger motor vehicles or commercial vehicle insurance lines.

1088.title: Relating to seniority rights and school consolidation
1088.description: The purpose of this bill is to permit classroom teachers or school service personnel who at the time of a school merger who are the sole occupants of the same positions that will exist at the new school will maintain that position at the new school. The bill requires the posting of service, professional or administrative positions only when duplicate positions exist.

1089.title: Permitting residential customers to deduct up to 50 percent of their electric utility payments from their federal adjusted gross income
1089.description: The purpose of this to permit residential customers of electric utilities to deduct up to 50% of their electric utility payments from their federal adjusted gross income for personal income tax purposes.

1090.title: Relating generally to financing political campaigns for elections
1090.description: The purpose of this bill is to revise provisions of state election law relating contributions for political campaigns, anonymous advertising to influence elections, and limits for various forms and circumstances of political contributions.

1091.title: Relating to submission of the budget bill
1091.description: The purpose of this bill is to require the Governor to include the state appropriation limitations the Legislature may not exceed when making aggregate General Revenue Fund appropriations in the budget bill submitted to the Legislature. It also requires that the limitations be updated annually.

1092.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
1092.title: Requiring influenza immunizations for health care workers
1092.description: The purpose of this bill is to require that all health care workers receive an influenza vaccination by October 1 every year.

1093.title: Relating to posession of a deadly weapon on a school bus or education grounds
1093.description: The purpose of this bill is to clarify that students are not prohibited to possess a firearm or other deadly weapon on a school bus as defined in section one, article one, chapter seventeen-a of this code or in or on a publicÂ primary or secondary education building, structure, facility or grounds including a vocational education building, structure, facility or grounds where secondary vocational education programs are conducted or at a school-sponsored function, or in or on a private primary or secondary education building, structure or facility.

1094.title: Relating generally to the disclosure of certain confidential information
1094.description: The purpose of this bill is to harmonize a potential code conflict regarding the disclosure of confidential information.

1095.title: Prohibiting retailers from selling or leasing products that make content accessible on the Internet
1095.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit retailers from selling or leasing products that make content accessible on the Internet, unless the product contains an active and operating digital blocking capability that renders obscene material inaccessible.

1096.last_action: To House Agriculture and Natural Resources
1096.title: Relating to the Farm-To-Food Bank Tax Credit
1096.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow the Farm-To-Food Bank Tax Credit to equal 100 percent of the value of the donated edible agricultural products when the value is $2,500 or less.

1097.title: Relating to verification of eligibility for employment
1097.description: The purpose of this bill is to assure that all persons hired in this state have their identity verified; authorizes the use of the federal E-Verify program to verify employment eligibility, require documents relating to verification of eligibility be retained, and authorizing the Commissioner of Labor to propose acceptable alternative forms of identification by rule.

1098.title: Freezing the contribution of public employees for their health insurance costs through the Public Employees Insurance Agency
1098.description: The purpose of this bill is to cap the amount of contribution and out of pocket expenses for state employees for their Public Employee Insurance Agency health insurance.

1099.title: Establishing a system of district courts of appeals to serve as an intermediate level of appeals in judicial proceedings
1099.description: The purpose of this bill is to establish district courts of appeals to serve as an intermediate level of appeals in judicial matters.

1100.last_action: To House Prevention and Treatment of Substance Abuse
1100.title: Authorizing magistrates to order emergency removal of child when parent’s drug use creates unsafe environment
1100.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide for magistrate to have ability to remove child from a home in which parent’s use of drugs is causing an unsafe environment for the child. Â

1101.title: Nullifying certain adoption orders
1101.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow adult adoptees who are residents of the state to nullify adoption orders of state courts.

1102.title: Allowing municipalities to cancel elections when only one person is running
1102.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow municipalities to cancel municipal elections and appoint candidates by acclamation, if there is only one candidate running for each municipal office up for election.

1103.title: Relating to probation and parole
1103.description: The purpose of this bill is to add certain sanctions for violations of probation and parole. The bill provides for a system of graduated sanctions. The bill establishes the conditions of community supervision. The bill grants authority to impose graduated sanctions. The bill provides for the monitoring of graduated sanctions. The bill defines terms. The bill requires rule-making.

1104.title: Establishing motor vehicle registration plates for official vehicles of emergency management agencies
1104.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the issuance of special “Emergency Management” motor vehicle plates to authorized emergency management vehicles of the state or political subdivision.

1105.title: Permitting public employees the right to collectively bargain
1105.description: The purpose of this bill is to permit public employees the right to collectively bargain. The bill provides for an exclusive representative. The bill provides a procedure. The bill sets forth matters subject to collective bargaining.

1106.title: Providing local government the authority to place video cameras at road intersections
1106.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide local governments the authority to place video cameras at intersections.

1107.last_action: To House Prevention and Treatment of Substance Abuse
1107.title: Relating to terminating parental rights if an infant has tested positive for a Schedule I drug
1107.description: The purpose of this bill is to require the Department of Health and Human Resources to file a petition or otherwise seek a ruling in any pending proceeding to terminate parental rights if an infant has tested positive for a Schedule I drug.

1108.title: Relating to the procedure to determine if an occupation or profession should be regulated
1108.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide that the procedure to determine if an occupation or profession should be regulated in West Virginia is prohibited if the occupation or profession is regulated in fewer than 25 other states. The bill also provides that a license of an occupation or profession regulated in West Virginia should expire if the occupation or profession is regulated in fewer than 25 other states. The statute providing the procedure for regulation or occupations and professions is referred to as a “Sunrise” statute.

1109.title: Requiring that free feminine hygiene products be provided to female prisoners
1109.description: The purpose of this bill is to require that free feminine hygiene products be provided to female prisoners in regional jails or state correctional facilities and female juveniles in juvenile detention.

1110.title: Permitting retail liquor licensees to sell alcoholic beverages after one o’clock p.m. on Sundays
1110.description: The purpose of this bill is to permit retail sale of alcoholic beverages after 1 p.m. on Sundays.

1111.title: Authorizing employed investigators of the Board of Medicine, the Board of Osteopathy and the Board of Pharmacy to carry concealed handguns
1111.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize an employed investigator between the ages of 18 and 21 of the Board of Medicine, the Board of Osteopathy and the Board of Pharmacy to carry a concealed handgun.

1112.title: Changing the licensing requirement for certain casino employees
1112.description: The purpose of this bill is to change the licensing requirement for certain casino employees from a licensure to a registration.

1113.title: Relating generally to school calendars
1113.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide that the instructional term for students begins on the Tuesday after Labor Day and ends the Friday before Memorial Day. The bill provides an exception. The bill permits additional instruction minutes per day. The bill eliminates reimagined days.

1114.title: Providing immunity from civil liability to facilities and employees providing crisis stabilization
1114.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide immunity to certain facilities and providers of certain crisis services.

1115.title: Providing that proceeds from certain oil and gas wells that are due to persons whose name or address are unknown be kept in a special fund
1115.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide that proceeds from certain oil and gas wells that are due to persons whose name or address are unknown are to be kept in a special fund and if unclaimed within seven years the proceeds shall be transferred to the Oil and Gas Reclamation Fund. The bill provides that if there is a surface disturbance those named surface owners of a leased interest subject to pooling for a horizontal well are the only surface owners insofar as the well permit is concerned. The bill provides that if another surface owner should become known his or her name shall be added as a surface owner on the permit. The bill provides that if proceeds from other mineral tracts in a unit or pool of a horizontal well are not claimed by an unknown, missing or abandoned owner within seven years the proceeds shall be transferred to the Oil and Gas Reclamation Fund. The bill provides that certain provisions take effect beginning when funds have been unclaimed for seven years after the special commissioner’s lease regardless of when the lease was signed. The bill authorizes rulemaking.

1116.title: Relating to the assessment of nonoccupied property owned by out-of-state individuals
1116.description: The purpose of this bill is to assess nonoccupied property owned by out-of-state individuals or other legal entities with an additional $4 an acre with the revenue dedicated to the Public Employees Insurance Agency to reduce costs of insurance.

1117.title: Relating to qualifications for a limited video lottery operator’s license
1117.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide that any applicant who has a retail (ABC) license for beer, wine or liquor may qualify for a limited video lottery operator’s license.

1118.title: Establishing certain criteria for the restricted operation of drones within State Parks, Forests, and Rail Trails
1118.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit the banning of the use of recreational drones at state parks except within 150 feet from lodging.

1119.last_action: To House Small Business, Entrepreneurship and Economic Development
1119.title: Creating a consumer's sales and service tax exemption for motion pictures
1119.description: The purpose of this bill is to create a consumers sales and service tax exemption for motion pictures and other commercial film or audiovisual projects in West Virginia.

1120.title: Relating to advertising by physicians and podiatrists
1120.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide that the use of patient testimonials in advertising by physicians and podiatrists is not per se false or deceptive advertising.

1121.title: Authorizing the city of White Sulphur Springs, Greenbrier County, West Virginia, to expend both principal and interest from a special interest-bearing fund
1121.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow the city of White Sulphur Springs to spend money as needed from a special fund created in 1985 and to remove the limitation that previously allowed only the interest to be spent. This money may not be spent for salaries, equipment, or other expenses not directly related to capital improvements and infrastructure.

1122.last_action: To House Prevention and Treatment of Substance Abuse
1122.title: The Ryan Brown Addiction Prevention and Recovery Fund Act
1122.description: The purpose of this bill is to create the Ryan Brown Addiction Prevention and Recovery Fund Act.Â The bill provides legislative findings and purpose, requiring the Director of the West Virginia Department of Health and Human Resources to propose rules and definitions relating to the purpose of this article. The bill establishes the Ryan Brown Addiction Prevention and Recovery Fund to be administered by the West Virginia Department of Health and Human Resources which is to be funded from federal Substance Abuse Prevention and Treatment Block Grants (SABG), gifts, and income from the investment of moneys.Â The bill also provides how these funds are to be used.

1123.title: Prohibiting public utilities from prohibiting customers from constructing, installing, or maintaining a connection or other infrastructure
1123.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit public utilities from prohibiting customers from constructing, installing, or maintaining a connection or other infrastructure necessary for the customer to connect to the public utility to receive service.

1124.title: Providing funds from the State Excess Lottery Revenue Fund to the Ron Yost Personal Assistance Services Fund
1124.description: The purpose of this bill is to appropriate funds from the State Excess Lottery Revenue Fund to the Ron Yost Personal Assistance Services Fund, the Employment Attendant Care Program and to expand the network of Centers for Independent Living to help West Virginians with disabilities live in their own homes and communities, pursue and maintain gainful employment.

1125.title: Relating to education to children and adults housed in correctional facilities and regional jails
1125.description: The purpose of this bill is to remove language requiring specific appropriations in order for the State Board of Education, State Department of Education and the State Superintendent of Schools to provide education to children and adults in housed in correctional facilities and regional jails.

1126.title: Relating generally to forfeiture of contraband
1126.description: The purpose of this bill concerns forfeiture of contraband. The bill establishes criminal forfeiture and the items and property subject to forfeiture. The bill sets forth additional procedures for forfeiture. The bill establishes dates. The bill permits a court to waive a conviction requirement. The bill protects innocent owners. The bill permits seizure of personal property with and without process. The bill provides that there are no additional remedies and no joint and severable liability. The bill establishes title. The bill sets forth the disposition of forfeited property and proceeds. The bill establishes prohibition on retaining property. The bill establishes sales restrictions, return of property, damages, and costs. The bill permits the transfer of forfeited property to the federal government. The bill provides for preemption. The bill defines terms.

1127.title: Requiring a majority of affected persons to a minor boundary adjustment annexation to approve of the annexation
1127.description: The purpose of this bill is to require a majority of affected persons to a minor boundary adjustment annexation to approve of the annexation.

1128.title: Clarifying where a charge of DUI may be brought against an individual
1128.description: The purpose of this bill is to make clear that a charge of DUI may only be brought against an individual operating a vehicle on public highways or on private roads before or after entering or exiting a public highway.

1129.title: Relating to the authority of the Division of Protective Services
1129.description: The purpose of this bill is to give the Division of Protective Services the authority to compel dispersal of an unlawful assemblage.

1130.title: Relating to supporting implementation of comprehensive systems for teacher and leader induction and professional growth
1130.description: Relating to supporting implementation of comprehensive systems for teacher and leader induction and professional growth

1133.title: Relating to authorizing legislative rules regarding higher education
1133.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize legislative rules of the Higher Education Policy Commission and the Council for Community and Technical College Education.

1134.title: Relating to obtaining substance abuse treatment services
1134.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide a process for pregnant and postpartum persons to receive substance use treatment.

1274.title: Term Limits for Senators and Delegates in the West Virginia Legislature
1274.description: The purpose of this resolution is to limit the number of terms a senator or delegate may serve in the West Virginia Legislature.

1275.title: Manufacturing Inventory and Equipment Tax Exemption Amendment
1275.description: The purpose of this resolution is to propose an amendment to the West Virginia Constitution that would exempt personal property in the form of manufacturing inventory and manufacturing equipment from ad valorem taxation.

1276.title: Veteran's Property Tax Exemption Amendment
1276.description: The purpose of this resolution is to provide for an election to amend the state Constitution to exempt honorably discharged veterans of the Armed Forces of the United States from ad valorem property taxation on the first $30,000 of assessed value of his or her primary residence.

1277.title: Homestead Exemption Increase Amendment
1277.description: The purpose of this resolution is to increase the homestead exemption from $20,000 to $30,000.

1278.title: State Apportionment Commission
1278.description: The purpose of this resolution is to propose an amendment to the state Constitution that would allow citizens to participate directly in the formation of legislative districts by creating a nonpartisan citizen commission which will hold public hearings around the state and present a redistricting bill to the Legislature.

1280.title: The Simple Majority Levy Approval Amendment
1280.description: The purpose of this resolution is to amend the state Constitution to allow simple majority approval for county, city and municipal tax levies.

1281.title: Volunteer Emergency Service Personnel Property Tax Exemption Amendment
1281.description: The purpose of this resolution is to exempt each volunteer emergency service worker, including each volunteer firefighter, from ad valorem property taxation on the first $30,000 of assessed value of his or her primary residence.

1283.title: Prohibiting the Governmental Taking of Private Property for Private Use Amendment
1283.description: Prohibiting the Governmental Taking of Private Property for Private Use Amendment

1284.title: Super-Majority Required for Passage of Tax Bill Amendment
1284.description: The purpose of this joint resolution is to propose an amendment to the Constitution to require that, with exception, bills imposing a tax or license fee and bills increasing the effective rate of any tax levied or fee imposed, may not be enacted unless two thirds of the members of each house, present and voting, vote in the affirmative for passage.

1285.title: Initiative, Referendum, and Recall Amendment
1285.description: The purpose of this resolution is to amend the state Constitution to give the people the powers of initiative, referendum and recall. The resolution sets forth its scope,

1286.last_action: To House Agriculture and Natural Resources
1286.title: Right to Hunt and Fish in West Virginia Amendment
1286.description: Right to Hunt and Fish in West Virginia Amendment

1287.title: Senior Citizen Homestead Valuation Amendment
1287.description: The purpose of this resolution is to propose a constitutional amendment that would lock the value of a homestead property owned by a citizen of sixty-five years of age or older, for the purpose of calculating property taxes, at the assessed value when the owner-occupier turned sixty-five or purchased the property, whichever occurred later.

1288.title: Life Begins at Conception Amendment
1288.description: The purpose of this resolution is to define the word “person” or “persons” as those terms are used in Article III of the State Constitution, to include every human being from the moment of fertilization, cloning, or the functional equivalent thereof.

1289.title: Senators and Delegates Service Limit Amendment
1289.description: The purpose of this resolution is to amend the State Constitution to limit persons serving as Senators or Delegates from serving more than twelve total years.

1290.title: Proposing an amendment to the Constitution of the State of West Virginia relating to education, and providing for the election of members of the State Board of Education
1290.description: The purpose of this resolution is to propose an amendment to the State Constitution providing for the election of members of the State Board of Education from the congressional districts, beginning with the general election in the year 2020.

1291.title: Proposing an amendment to the Constitution of the State of West Virginia relating to exempting honorably discharged veterans of the Armed Forces of the United States
1291.description: The purpose of this resolution is to provide for an election to amend the state Constitution to exempt honorably discharged veterans of the Armed Forces of the United States who have been determined to have a ten percent or more disability from ad valorem property taxation on the first $30,000 of assessed value of his or her primary residence.

1292.title: Judicial Budget Oversight Amendment
1292.description: The purpose of this resolution is to propose an amendment to the West Virginia Constitution giving the Legislature the sole authority to determine what funds are necessary for the efficient and effective operation of the legislative, executive and judicial departments.

1293.title: Business Inventory Exemption Amendment
1293.description: The purpose of this resolution is to exempt personal property held in inventory by a business, and business equipment owned by a business from taxation. Strike-throughs indicate language that would be stricken from a heading or the present law and underscoring indicates new language that would be added.

1294.title: Election of West Virginia Board of Education members amendment
1294.description: Â The purpose of this amendment is to provide for rulemaking oversight and for the election of six members of the West Virginia Board of Education, every four years, in a manner provided by law.

1296.title: Constitutional Officers Term Limit Amendment
1296.description: The purpose of this resolution is to amend the State Constitution to limit the terms of any persons serving as Senators, Delegates, and Governor.

1297.title: Just Cut Taxes and Win or JCTAW Amendment
1297.description: The purpose of this resolution is to submit the proposed "Just Cut Taxes and Win or JCTAW Amendment" to the Constitution of the State to the people of the State for ratification or rejection at the general election of 2018.

1298.title: Taxpayer Bill of Rights
1298.description: The purpose of this resolution is to propose an amendment to §51, Article VI of the Constitution to establish a general fund expenditure limit.Â The amendment is designated “Taxpayer Bill of Rights.”
